author: {'steamid': '76561197999427639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1593607404}
review:
[h1]В целом:[/h1]
[b]Симулятор пострелушек из-за угла с рандомизованной зачисткой кустов[/b]

[h1]Положительное:[/h1]
+ [b]Визуальная стилизация вкусная[/b], но специфичная, можно даже сказать на любителя. Вся графика игры выстроена из мощностей движка (поэтому, игра весит 200 мб), но картинка довольно простенькая, хоть и стильная. 
+ [b]Пиу-пиу из револьвера[/b] делать приятно. Стреляет он точно, быстро и мощно, все враги отлетают от одного попадания (но револьвер МакКри получше будет). Необычная механика - вручную подбирать и перезаряжать каждую выстреленную пулю, по сути, ваши патроны бесконечны, пока вы их вовремя собираете.
+ [b]Требовательна к меткости[/b], те буквально, чем ты точней, тем легче/быстрей проходишь игру. Однако, частенько у тебя есть возможность пострелять ракетами, покидать бомбы и сделать чик-чирик ножичком, но вот тут начинаются проблемки...
+ [b]Полезный саунддизайн[/b] позволяет индентифицировать присутствие врагов, монет, пуль, магазинов. У музыки проблема со сменяемостью/своевременностью. Треки вроде задорные, но ничего кроме [b]BANG-BANG![/b] магазина вспомнить не могу (хотя играл 5 минут назад).

[h1]Отрицательное:[/h1]
- [b]Низкая вариативность[/b], сомнительный рогалик эта игра. С 1го по 8й уровень ты гарантированно встретишь все виды врагов, все типовые комнаты. У игры, на самом деле, нет реиграбельности, есть только подобие, ввиде банка (куда между сессиями можно закидывать доллары и целый 1 (!) предмет) и генерации типовых уровней. Те, пройдя игру единожды, в ней делать нечего, откровенно говоря.
- [b]Отстойная система предметов[/b]. По базе ты можешь носить только 1 предмет в ограниченном количестве (например, только 2 одинаковые пилюли в руках, больше ничего). Хочешь больше - качай количество за доллары, покупай рюкзак, чтобы носить целых 2 (!) предмета. А что можно носить? Аптечки, нож, мины/ракеты/бомбы, пилюли, завещание и артефакты (в основном, пассивные свойства слегка меняющие геймплей). В игре практически нет комбинаторики.
Большинство предметов бесполезно, особенно атакующих. У тебя есть мощный и точный револьвер убивающий всех врагов с одного выстрела, тебе не нужны бомбы, мины, ракеты и все их вариации в игре, тк они работают плохо и нестабильно, не говоря о том, что ими легко подорвать самого себя (а ещё, если ты получишь пулю, пока в руках держишь бомбу - ты взорвёшься). Большинство артефактов же влияют на геймплей слишком слабо, чтобы вообще их брать с собой. Вот и получается, что носишь ты с собой только аптечки да  пилюли (краткое замедление времени) или завещание, если дела идут плохо.
- [b]Тупые и сломанные враги[/b]. Все враги просто ждут пока ты появишься в поле зрения, как только заметили - и тупо прут вперёд на тебя (если есть ноги) и стреляют (если есть чем стрелять). Местные турельки знают о твоем положении несмотря на стены и стреляя по кулдауну в направлении тебя (даже если не должны видеть), тут и начинается это дёрганье от угла к углу. Со стенами вообще в игре проблемы, то взрывы сквозь "непроницаемую" стену пройдут, то монетки проедут, то враги "почувствуют".
Отдельно хочется упомянуть местных змей розового цвета, впиханных в каждый второй розовый куст, что развивает параною у игрока и бесконечную стрельбу по кустам. 
- [b]Декоративный фонарик[/b]. На 5м уровне тебе дают фонарик и ты такой "ВО! теперь будет выживание во тьме, механики освещения, заметность/незаметность, игра свето-тени, вот это всё!" Нет. Тебя обманули. Тебе просто дали фонарик светящий розовым светом. Ни на что в игре это не влияет, хоть +/- стильно выглядит. Враги видны всегда, хоть свети - хоть не свети на них.

[h1]P.S.[/h1]
Долго думал, как оценить эту игру. С одной стороны, у неё неплохой, напряженный и скилозависимый геймплей. С другой, он напряженный и интересный только в первую игровую сессию, а затем рутина с повторением одних и тех же паттернов. Остановился всё таки на негативном, так как то что ты увидел в первые 15 минут игры - это вся игра в целом. Дальше, ты ожидаешь от игры большего, но этого не происходит и это разочаровывает.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882608048', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1593291170}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998212552', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1592584546}
review:
Bof. Et pourtant j'adore les rogue-like et les FPS. 

Mais les sensations de tir (le gunplay) sont quasi-nulles. La musique n'est là que pour vous empêcher d'entendre les ennemis ; elle est sympa mais baissez là un peu. La direction artistique est inexistante (voire de mauvais goût). Les ennemis déjà vus ailleurs. Le jeu est ultra simple si on fait gaffe ... Mais à force de recommencer (vu que c'est un rogue-like) on va plus vite, et on se fait ne fait blesser quasiment que par les vers géants (ennemi le plus relou au monde, quelle idée de mettre un ennemi caché dans un rogue-like, ça casse le rythme qui n'avait vraiment pas besoin de ça). 

Puis à mi-parcours on tombe sur le premier boss, ("ennemi le plus dur du jeu" selon le wiki et je veux bien le croire, super l'équilibrage) qui vous explose (au sens propre). A propos du wiki, servez-vous en pour comprendre à quoi servent les nombreux objets que vous trouverez. Hélas la plupart sont d'un intérêt limité, et d'autres indispensables.  

En résumé boaarff. Jouez à Doom 2016 à la place. Oui ça n'est qu' "un fps" mais c'est pas cher et au moins on s'amuse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847525101', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1700436678}
review: actually serves as a pretty good aim warmup before you play competitive games due to the “precision” aiming as well as quick response time required to deal with some enemies for sure pick this up if it’s on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108401', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1592091368}
review:
[h1] crap game [/h1]
narrow corridors, very linear levels and linear enemy movement makes aiming boring. It's just twitch reactions and being very careful. That god damn worm hides in the grass and is overlooked easily. Limited ammo, pickung back up bullets (which somehow can be fired again without reworking the bullet) and manually reloading every bullet into your revolver forces you to play careful and safe. You gotta watch your every step. That makes the gameplay really not fun, but just a chore I don't want to go through. I'm a very skilled FPS player, it's not about the difficulty, but about the tasks this game asks of you. They're not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054428727', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1591839255}
review: It's simplistic, unbalanced, and boring. The only part that I really liked was the main gimmick of needing to grab your bullets. Besides that, the enemies were either useless fodder (imps) or overpowered (turrets, snakes). Fighting either the turrets or snakes also slows down what could've been a fast paced game, making it even more boring. The levels are blocky, basic rooms with random foliage. The items are unimaginative. I wouldn't play this for anything more than $0.

author: {'steamid': '76561198439811017', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1622817439}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025812458', 'num_games_owned': 1991, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1591014456}
review: For a lot of people, myself included, the game runs terribly and will stutter and lag whenever anything happens on-screen. It's apparently a Unity engine problem that's only relevant to certain hardware, so the best I can say is use the 2hr refund window to work out if it's playable or not to you. For me, it's not. Shame as well because the game seems challenging and relatively fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134251443', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1590935358}
review: It's a boring minimalistic roguelike with very few enemies/upgrades and asshole designs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198851435835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1702281876}
review:
Heavy Bullets is the arcade shooter I've ever wanted. Imagine pac-man if it were a first person shooter, the maze always changes, and you can shoot the ghosts; that's the vibe this game has.

Every time you play the game, the maze is different, so it doesn't give you an opportunity to memorize enemy locations, forcing you to rely on raw first person shooter skill to traverse the dungeon.

In some dreamlike fantasy world I knew this game already existed and here it is. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes arcade games and shooters. If you're worried that this game won't have enough substance to hold your attention, I can say that it does have an addictive quality that makes you want to keep going, learning how to deal with the existing game mechanics to give yourself an edge over the ever changing mazes.

I give this game a personal 4/5 for what it is. The only thing it lacks is a compelling story, but it doesn't exactly need one. Perfect game to listen to music and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967389126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1491677518}
review:
It's an ok game, but feels more like itch.io material. The level aesthetics are so blocky and repetitive, which I guess stems from the plot, but it got old before I beat the game.

Some interesting concepts but ultimately a flawed execution. The dev's growth is palpable in their later games compared to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993501215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1445739507}
review: Played for less then an hour and already bored. Great concept but its just got pretty much no replayablity unfortunatly. Lots of wasted potental for this one and it feels more like a cash grab for those sweet retro dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153689662', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1704948608}
review: This game is both hard and fun, and it has its own built in challenges to push you towards getting better. I can easily sink an afternoon into trying to get past that next level and then being set back, fuming for a bit, and then trying again. I'm not stupendously great at this game, and mostly get by through being the incredible Mr. Mag-loot. Regardless, it's a great game and I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002824793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1662432768}
review:
I have greatly enjoyed playing this game.
Running through the neon halls of this hunting ground is nothing but an adrenaline rush with danger around every corner. Every death is a chance to learn. Watch those corners, don't stop moving, beware of the foliage, don't blow yourself up and most importantly always pick up your bullets. There's noting worse then realizing you've lost half your bullets. I recommend playing this game. I have had hours of fun and am still playing today. I got it on sale and haven't regretted it. Join me in the halls of terror.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982878677', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1588789073}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056174221', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1650643305}
review:
Классика девольверов. Красочные, токсично-яркие уровни с интересными мобами. 
Игра не требует безумного аима (хоть и не помешал бы), но скорей осторожности. 
 Единственный минус, который могу назвать, это краши, лично у меня довольно часто посреди рана игра зависает и в итоге крашиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382748888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1588229417}
review: Gameplay wise, it's fast paced and challenging, and really fun. However, every time i play for more than 10 minutes it gives me a pretty bad migraine due to the color palette of the game, so I'd advise people with existing to stay away from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199023776624', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1571, 'last_played': 1670286245}
review: 是个好游戏，感觉就像元气骑士的第一人称电脑版......希望物品可以有点介绍或者加个图鉴。还有就是这画风着实有点恐怖，不过我喜欢（手动滑稽）

author: {'steamid': '76561198049926216', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1588384028}
review:
솔직히 보스를 제외하면, 포도알이 제일 무섭습니다.

시작과 동시에 6발이 장전된 리볼버와 3개의 폭탄이 지급됩니다.
총알은 탄착 지점에서 다시 회수할 수 있으므로, 보스전만 아니었다면 6발도 과분했을 것입니다.
그리고 수류탄은 기가 막히게 쓸모가 없습니다. 처음에 지급받는 갯수로도 클리어할 때까지 우려먹을 수 있을 것입니다.

보스전은 한 번에 깨기가 쉽진 않습니다.
약점이 감춰져있진 않지만, 나름의 대책이 존재합니다.

가끔 바위를 뚫고 지나오거나, 바위 속에서 공격해 올 수 있습니다.
당신의 공격은 바위에 막히니, 여러 발 쏘아 바위를 제거하거나, 적이 완전히 넘어 올 때까지 기다리십시오.

게임이 단순해서 아무나 할 수 있습니다.
아무에게나 추천하십시오.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310575050', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1587413506}
review:
This game made me kind of mad. I usually never get angry at games (unless I'm playing with someone who sucks at playing games) but this game, oh boy..

There's points where I open a door and die. The framerate is also low as hell, and this game looks like crap. It should run really well and smooth but unfortunately, it's kind of slow. I lag when I get hurt, also when I get hit, it's like DOOM 3 when an enemy hits you...except here, it pisses me off way more than it does there.

This game doesn't deserve all these positive reviews. The game is super lazy and everything in it looks like someone went on Roblox and created this whole thing in like 3 minutes.

I don't recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012203940', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1599669679}
review: Dungeon crawler fps con elementi roguelike, Heavy Bullets è un concentrato di tattica, stile e bestemmie come pochi titoli al mondo: la meccanica trial and error dovuta a precise scelte di design e di gameplay può infatti sfiduciare anche i più tenaci. Graficamente è piuttosto peculiare da un punto di vista visivo, anche se non ottimizzato al meglio. Considerato che può arrivare a costare come un caffè, si può consigliare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963096957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1585506367}
review:
Довольно приятный визуал, звуки, интересна механика накопления. И при всей сложности хотелось бы поставить лайк, но...
Откуда у игры при таком минимализме и простеньких модельках косячная оптимизация или тормоза, как ещё это назвать? Хочешь на пару пикселей выглянуть из-за угла, жмёшь слегка в бок, и в следующую секунду ты уже в помещении на радость всем турелям, вертушкам и кусакам. Или подманиваешь из-за угла чернуху, чтоб пуля тут же подобралась, а у тебя глюк, и либо в последний момент успеваешь отскочить и выстрелить, либо получаешь укус. А визит к боссу на последнем с такими "сложностями" хоть 7 полных жизней у тебя вообще забей...
Или автоматы. На последнем уровне, например, ходишь как дурак с рудой, потому что всё равно в попадавшихся 3-х магазах денег уже не было закупиться, а банкомат так и не попался, а потом он в конце уровня, и вот у тебя есть нал или хоть косарь снимай, но жизни уже не восстановить - двери под лазером. Но когда начинаешь заново, тебе выпадает сразу НА ОДНОЙ ВТОРОЙ ЛОКЕ ДВА МЕСТА, ГДЕ СТОИТ БАНКОМАТ И ВОЗЛЕ НЕГО ЖЕ ТУМБА С РУДОЙ! (Скрины обоих мест загружу...) Да это не рандом, эт издевательство...

author: {'steamid': '76561198080753156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1586060625}
review: An FPS roguelite with a semi-vaporwave art style. You have to peek around every corner carefully, which may not be for everyone. A large number of interesting pickups spice things up, and a persistent bank balance encourages you to weigh whether you should max out yourself now, or deposit your cash to make future runs easier. I wouldn't say that Heavy Bullets is *hard*, but any mistake can cost you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062372128', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1585009494}
review:
this game looked really cool though when you actually play it, its not that great if im being 100% honest. ive gone back to it multiple times and feel the same way about it. lemme list the things i dislike and then things i like

dislikes: 
-the snakes!!! they're the same color as majority of the plants in the game so they hide in them making it tough to spot out when you are moving, meaning your going to spend so much time just slowly examining your surrounding, halting momentum. this sucks

-the slippery movement, it feels like your on ice. moving and shooting is ridiculously annoying to actually pull off right. in a shooter movement is important but when you move like your walking on a slip n slide it sure feels weird.

-lack of info on items, you'll get some passive item- cool! does not even give you a smidge of info about what it does, like the binding of isaac does it and even if its vague you have a noticeable diff of what it changed. here its just all vague

finally what i like:

-the artstyle, its sleek and cool looking. most FPS dont look like this one and i appreciate that.

thats about it tbh

tl:dr  this game is like trying to shoot a gun while balancing yourself on an oil covered slip-n-slide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131352763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1583882600}
review: Imagine this, your in the jungle and suddenly boom bang and bam!!! your dead! Welcome to the jungle BITCH! This game will make you feel hunted by this pitiless creatures. They have no remorse and will not relent until you are dead. I mean whats actually going on here?! Your just some random guy they promised to pay if you restart the computer system. What the hells up with all this cryptic writings? Why are your bullets reusable? WHY the fuck do these damn snakes keep biting me and I don't have any money to buy an antidote?! There are many secrets and more to uncover here but it a more show than tell kinda game. It rewards quick reaction times, and good perception and accuracy. Now just remember get that bread, buy those discounts, and make sure to buy life insurance. YOU may not make it but the next guy will appreciate the extra dosh when you die. Happy Hunting, You'll need it

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 2089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2089, 'last_played': 1479777037}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a fairly low effort procedurally generated low poly FPS with a garish/neon colour scheme because it costs money to hire artists so why not just do it yourself?  Oh yeah, because that would result in terrible graphics.  The gimmick, apart from procgen maps, is that you can re-use your bullets if you pick them up after you've shot them.  Exciting.

While the gameplay is fluid here, the game pace is exceedingly twitchy which isn't fun.  As previously mentioned, the graphics are awful.   I'm not sure if they genuinely tried to do nice graphics but were just incapable, or just didn't care at all.  As a reviewer, I care.   Secondly, time and time again developers need to be taught that procgen is not content. 

The $14.50 price tag for a low poly twitch FPS without any real content, just procgen sameyness, is laughable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030866017', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1566875891}

Apparently a recent update broke the game. Stuttering.

I still would rate it negatively. It is fun but extremely limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069604422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1706767631}
review:
This game used to be wonderful. I had 0 negative things to say about it. Eventually a strange stuttering set in, and thinking it was my PC, I wrote it off. Downloading it again on this computer a year or two later; 
     Nah. The stutter's the game. Other reviews listed an issue I thought was just my old hardware.
If this stutter wasn't here, it'd be high on my list, 8/10 at least... but it is. An FPS rogue-like based on sneaking, creeping, and fast reflexes stutters. I can't recommend anyone ever touch this game as long as this is an issue.

I'm sorry you've missed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984405758', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1578121554}
review:
I could not put this down until I beat it. 
Very simple FPS rogue-like about watching your blind spots, maxing your power up combos; and trying again and again and again.
The visuals are akin to a 3D representation of atari games. Looks a little bit like the first star fox too. I found that very charming. the sound of all the monsters are represented by chunky chirps and bassy bleeps, and serve to heighten the tense feeling of "where are they coming from?" the soundtrack comes in during the higher points of success and are very gratifying and well made.
I hope to see more from this developer, but he hasn't released anything in years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092518279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 51, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1712102949}

review:
Gripes:
* Turrets sometimes can get at you quicker than you can react.
* Difficult to Percieve Snakes in Grass.

Nices:
* Requires Tactical Careful Gameplay
* Bullets are a Commodity. Make sure to make every bullet count.
* Money Management for Perks\Health.

All in All:
I recommend purchasing the game if you like tactical gameplay where every reaction and decision means death or the ability to continue on.

This game is a very successful roguelike despite being a smaller caliber (pun intended) compared to Enter The Gungeon or The Binding of Isaac.

review: Simple but fun, difficult yet challenging all in all it comes down to a small hick up. The game skips. Sometimes when a monster is jumping right at you the game just freezes for a second. I'd say its a fairly difficult game for the average fps player. Not having a map can be confusing but the game blocks off where you've come from so it's not like you'll accidentally waste a bunch of time back tracking. Definitely going to take me some time to get used to it but ultimately, for the price, I'm giving this a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047883295', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 5035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4324, 'last_played': 1633571437}
review: One of my favorite games of all time. What an incredible, high-action, fast-paced, 100% unlimited replay-value game this is. One of the only games I've still yet to beat out of my entire library of 420 steam games. I can't even begin to emphasize how fun and challenging this game is. One second you'll be on top of the world and the next second you're completely dead. Or vice versa, you'll be hanging on by a thread and all of a sudden you'll be and overpowered walking tank. And everything is always pretty much your fault. Fantastic game, highly recommend.

review:
A very simple but satisfying roguelike that you can play casually, you shoot bullets then pick them right back up and have to tackle a range of different enemies which can attack up close or from a distance as you proceed to the next level. You then use the coins that you get from killing them to buy items or upgrades small, short, simple and fun.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046528648', 'num_games_owned': 2315, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1571557253}
review:
风格比较原始的rougelike游戏？
基本上就是较为稀缺的子弹和血量，迫使你在随机地图中推进。
看了一下演示，似乎就只有随机地形而已…并没有太多的攻击手段。
刚出年代或许还值得一试，但现在面对内容更加丰富的rougelike游戏，就显得很单调了。

整体上也没有什么吸引人的地方，特别是画面，令本来就比较单调的游戏显得更加贫乏…

review:
EDIT: This is yet another potentially classic indie game ruined by bugs and poor optimization.  How is it possible for a game with a low-poly visual aesthetic to still be unable to run smoothly at even 30FPS on modern hardware?

Original review: Thought this game was garbage until I realized:

a) it doesn't always spawn 3 laser turrets in the first room of the first level, i was just unlucky in my first game (procedural ftw)
b) you can shoot the turrets
c) you can pick up your own bullets after you shoot them

Now I think this game is great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198280405806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1621054680}

author: {'steamid': '76561198261727951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1567766498}
review:
不残血不会玩系列，抖M玩家快乐源泉。横批：心急见阎王
大部分敌人都可以卡转角杀，但是运气不好的时候一个大房间三挺炮台架着你门口，不得不换血。
草丛里的蛇仔细看都能发现，小心点打进入第四关基本没问题。
第四关开始会有拉慢你速度的炮台和正面无敌的小怪，前者在boss房必定有一个，建议嗑专注药丸优先解决，后者当然是引诱撞墙然后打♂尻将其做掉。
我在第四关卡关的，菜是原罪。每次在boss房前都残血没得补血，我太难了。

然后讲一下目前我见过的买不到的道具：
放大瞄准镜  只捡过一次，神器，道具键开镜/关镜
装填手  自动装填近距离弹回来的子弹  
传送器  道具键第一下设置一次性坐标，第二下传送 
骇入工具  能开红色门锁 
探测器  离威胁越近越响
带刺头盔  不知道什么用
什么试管  效果跟蛇有关
起爆器  道具键远程引爆视野内炸弹
防爆背心   扛爆炸伤害

欢迎留言补充和订正

author: {'steamid': '76561198256727856', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1575737207}

author: {'steamid': '76561198273029227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1650823944}
review:
A fun and very affordable game! Movement mechanics feels like the classic DOOM games, with a trippy art-style and scary enemies that can easily punish you if you are not careful. 

The game mechanics also remind me of Enter the Gungeon, where you start at the first level and start over when you die, as well as the level randomizer. I do really enjoy the bank system concept, where you can save coins you deposit and can use in future runs.

I played for a solid hour the first time I played, and it only felt like 5-10 minutes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040161742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1566458804}
review:
I purchased the game a few days ago, just played it. First thing I did was turn sensitivity up, and FOV up, before even trying it, like I do in all games. Immediately it was STUTTERY AS A MOFO AND HAD TERRIBLE FRAME RATES.
I've since turned down the sensitivity to like a 12, and the FOV back to 70, and it's still bad, really bad. 

Then I checked the forums and honestly, the first thread that jumped out has 17 pages about the same issue, going back to 2015. It sucks knowing that there's 17 pages in just one thread and the game hasn't been fixed. Especially considering I can play almost everything else at max settings WHILE recording in OBS, without any of this nonsense laggy stuttering bullshit. 
What. A. Shame.
If it didn't give you an achievement for dying once, I'd have refunded this, as the stutter and frame rate skips are just THAT bad.
FWIW, this is my first negative review on Steam. The gameplay seems decent, I want to like the game. There's a few annoying things that could have been done better, like the banking navigation for buying items and so forth. But man, the S-T-U-T-T-E-R-I-N-G is just a literal killer for me and if it hadn't given me the garbage achievement for dying, I'd have requested a refund.
BUYER BEWARE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977287590', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2263, 'last_played': 1672694352}
review: I love everything about this game.  The simple graphics that nevertheless combined with creepy sounds manage to scare the crap out of me on occasion, even after nearly 40 hours.  Extremely clever the way they make the snakeworms just hard enough to spot in the bushes.  With the randomization, I never know what's around each corner. Taking a large room full of turrets and beasts and methodically dismantling all threats is a satisfying challenge.  The mechanics, the music, the humor, the secret items (cursed gem is the best... exploding bullets! Changes the tactics entirely)...  I'm a sucker for roguelikes and this is one of my favorites.  To the people complaining about stutter, I grieve for you, and all I can say is it doesn't impact me, thank goodness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030735248', 'num_games_owned': 1531, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1614295518}
review:
Cannot recommend due to a stutter issue that affects many who bought the game (and are well past any refund period). No real effort taken to fix the issue, either, and no disclosure at or before purchase time. There's just no excuse for it with the low-effort graphics. It might work for you (some act like people made this problem up), just be ready to refund if need be. Note: I've been trying to play an earlier version downloaded via depot — thus the hours played — but even earlier versions stutter very badly, though to a lesser degree than the latest. It's a pretty shitty workaround but it's something. 

Will avoid anything else by this developer on GP.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993311892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1565037980}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a fun roguelite that is unfortunately plagued by bad performance. The game stutters now and again on the first few levels but as you progress to the second half it gets worse and worse causing it to become unplayable near the end. 

I've read in the forums that the developer has abandoned the issue and moved on to other games, but i didn't look around to verify that for myself. I guess the fact that the issue continues to exist and the developer has stopped responding to people on the forums is proof by itself. Let me say that the stuttering issue doesn't affect everybody. There are many players that say that the game runs fine for them.

In the end, the decision whether to buy the game or not is your own but know that you might be buying something that is almost unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197943921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1611646776}
review:
This game has a pretty cool design, but is somewhat underwhelming in terms of content. I really like the structure and overall feel, but it's fairly shallow where gameplay is concerned. The AI is very basic, and every run feels more or less the same, because there isn't enough variety to keep it fresh over multiple playthroughs. I can't stress enough that the basic structure of the game is very fun and unique, but it just gets tiresome after a while. I didn't really feel incentivised to progress because after a few hours I knew that it would more or less be the same experience each time. I still come back and play it every once in a while, and enjoy myself, but it's not really enough to stay hooked for any significant length of time.

It has an awesome art style and aesthetic, its just a shame that there isn't more to do. If you like what you see in the trailer, then by all means purchase it. My only real criticism of the game is the lack of content, and it is still very enjoyable in and of itself.

review: This is a brutal FPS Rogue-like with procedurally generated levels bathed in neon colors and minimalist artwork. There are power ups to purchase or find within secret locations and hidden panels throughout the games levels. The game is a lot of fun, however, beware as the engine has a problem with micro-stutters that the devs apparently have not corrected leading to cheap deaths. If you can handle the frustration, this is a fun game and can be rewarding once your character is buffed with some good power ups and stats from the vending machines.

review:
The vsync input lag is so god awful that it makes this game unplayable since you need to have precise aim to blow up the power boxes on turrets and while you are fighting the input lag to be able to aim at the box you will take hits from the turrets. Even if the input lag wasn't an issue though, it's just another poor attempt at a roguelike game. Hidden enemies that run at you and blow you up, hidden snakes in the grass that dmg you, you can only heal if rng allows you to come across a machine that sells health, just a bunch of dumb BS.

-77/10 refunded buttgarbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1560727351}
review:
There are two obvious ways to make your roguelike compelling. The first and most obvious is to have really engaging gameplay, like fun combat, exciting movement, or clever tactical options. The second is to just give it a ton of depth, I mean tons of systems or complex mechanics or a boatload of unlockables, all to give players something to focus on in their misadventures. My problem with Heavy Bullets is that it doesn’t seem to do either. The gunplay is competent but slow and methodical, practically the antithesis of the FPS genre. And there’s very little new to look forward to in subsequent runs, with little in the way of items to find or systems to master. Heavy Bullets needs more to keep me invested, plain and simple, and it’s just not there.

Don’t get me wrong, I love the premise. You’re one of a legion of janitors in a high-rise indoor hunting ground for the wealthy and decadent. Thing is, something went wrong with the security system and it’s started gunning down the wrong sorts of people. Nobody with any authority wants to risk their neck to get past the scads of automated gun turrets and reset the system, so the executives have put a reward out for anyone willing to do the deed. This might just be your ticket out of this dead-end dystopian job, which is why you’ve taken up your thick-ass company revolver and set off into the hunting grounds. And if the turrets or the wildlife get you, there’s always another hot-blooded janitor waiting in the wings.

The hunting grounds themselves are a tangle of vibrant hallways and dark foliage, like a laser tag arena that’s been viciously overgrown. Levels are roughly linear but the actual shape and connections of hallways are randomized, so you’ll be taking different twists and turns each run despite always heading in the same direction. You’ve got eight levels to descend through to reset the security system, and while there might not be too many differences between their neon gradient walls, the threats lurking within them do indeed change. Early on you’ll face toothy imps that charge you, poisonous snakes that lie in wait under bushes, and automated turrets that can lock onto you in an instant. Later the foes get leggier, denser, and more deadly, adding explosive critters and security systems with even smaller weaknesses.

None of these foes are very complicated to deal with, because you don’t have any complex tools to deal with them. Your main weapon (and only weapon, most of the time) is a revolver that fires six meaty bullets, bullets of such stature that they bounce off of foes after disintegrating them and must be scooped back up to re-use. Seriously, you start with six bullets, and the only way to get more is to buy them from vending machines or pray they appear as random rewards to grab. It’s not an issue early on because you can pop the one or two enemies in a room and then recover your rounds, but later you’ll need a deeper reserve to deal with more densely-packed rooms. You do also have a small supply of grenades, and vending machines and rewards also offer one-off weapons like rockets or mines to occupy your single item slot, competing with other consumables like health potions and passive boosters.

Aside from some purchasable upgrades from vending machines and the ability to bank cash and items for future runs, that’s it for the mechanics of Heavy Bullets. The bullet recovery gimmick is notable, but not all that different from grabbing pickups from fallen foes in any other FPS to keep going. What it really means is that every shot must be careful and deliberate, and enemies tend to either be stationary or bee-line towards you to make ammo conservation easier. There’s no running and gunning here, as charging forward will just get you iced by turrets. It shares its pace with something like Void Bastards, except there’s nowhere near the same level of interactivity or exploration to help balance out the pace of the game.

I think that’s what’s so disappointing about Heavy Bullets, the fact that it compares unfavorably to just about any other FPS you care to mention. The look and feel is similar to something like Receiver, but not built around anything nearly as compelling as the gunplay in that game. There’s no verticality or setpieces to any of the levels, but even something like Bunker Punks did more with that formula with gear to manage and more strategic choices. I wouldn’t say the core of the game is actually bad, but it doesn’t provide a compelling reason to play it over anything else in the genre. It’s a shame because I really do like the concept, and the satisfying THUNK of fat bullets against enemies doesn’t get old. I just wish there was anything else to invest in here besides that.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132604877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1534711847}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a game i desperately tried to love for a year or so now. unfortunatley i simply cannot get into it, the game fails as both a roguelite and a competent shooter.

As a roguelite, Heavy Bullets only achieves the bare minimum,and then less.it consists of randomly generated levels ,a shop system, some items, and hard as balls enemies.however, unlike most roguelites. the level layout is almost entirely random. with only some elements reused throughout each run. this means that any system you encounter during one run, like a shop or item. has a high chance of straight up not being present on the floor at all on your next time around. this gives the floors a sense of unreliability , as you have no idea what will be on each floor, ruining the sense of predictable unpredctability that most roguelites have. everything else is nothing to write home about, your typical shop system, unintresting items. the whole lot.

as a shooter, it fails to be compelling whatsoever. the gunplay is very barebones ,with weak sounds and a lack of impact. repetitive enemies and strategies. the concept of reusing your bullets is neat, but it feels more cumbersome than practical as you progress. the enemy design is where it gets juicy however:as most enemies are very basic in terms of design. to compensate for this, the enemies move or act extremely quickly. unfortunatley they act so quickly that most of the time if there are multiple enemies you don't have even a second to think about how you're going to tackle a situation before having to hide behind a wall. not like it matters. as most charging enemies can be easily defeated by luring them behind a wall and just going to town.


The way Heavy Bullets is designed makes every single important aspect feel like an afterthought, despite being the forefront of the experience. it feels like multiple systems from multiple games were cobbled together in an attempt to make something cohesive, and it falls flat on its face at almost every turn. but hey at least it looks pretty 

3.5/10

review: Couldn't get any enjoyment out of it. One of Yahtzee's jokes about PUBG fits this really well: "Where's Wally with your life." It's a game of peeking into a room and having to spot the three pixels obscured by some shrubbery that are going to kill you when you take another step into the room. The art direction is so overblown and cluttered trying to make everything stands out that absolutely nothing stands out and it's just a mess, gameplay-wise and visually.

review: Fun and fast moving FPS with permadeath and interesting meta progression. Takes some practice to get a feel for the game. Great music, sounds and environment that keeps you on the edge of your seat and will scare you several times! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198153288194', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1551052140}
review:
most of the damage i've taken is from snakes, who're near impossible to see sometimes, which pretty much means you have to play the game very slowly and carefully so you don't take damage, which in my opinion makes the game very tedious to play through.

i've also had enemies see me through walls and one time a turret shot me through a wall.

poison is awful, one attack shouldn't have the ability to deal damage multiple times 

items are disappointing, all the bombs are underwhelming and you can only throw them 3 feet, shoes of running are dumb considering the snakes, mines are pointless considering if you have time to place a mine down for a running enemy you can just shoot it, i had no problem hitting them

turrets are too unpredictable where they fire and the time in between attacks differs too much

the art style makes enemies hard to see, and the background plants make some enemies plain invisible, like the bomb rock enemy who punishes you for not seeing them through the awful art design by taking a full heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996323266', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1772, 'last_played': 1681626733}
review: PLEASE BUY THIS GAME. Randomly generated worlds keep the game fresh and you get jumpscared by things that aren't scary. There amazing enemies, and this is a great game you can just sit down and play. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054725871', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1557341793}
review:
Sad to give this one a negative.  It's rather fun, but the frequent lag spikes ruin the flow and really punish the player in the heat of battle (by which the oversaturation of enemies can trigger).  My only other complaint is that 90% of the items are next to useless, and you can only carry one (or two) at a time, so by the last levels, you're barely any better equipped than from the start of the game.

The best way to play is slow and methodical, using sound cues, and hugging walls, and I just got burnt out by the combination of blind corners, enemy swarms, and lag spikes.

Get this developer's other game (High Hell).  That was a fantastic experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013257090', 'num_games_owned': 1956, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1549422684}
review:
In general the game is mediocore. Upgrades and items aren't very interesting. Core gameplay, the shooting, is decent. 

The huge deal-breaking negative for me, are the graphics. Low poly is fine, no problem. What IS a problem are the enemies who all blend into the terrain, often on purpose. Just feels cheap and gets aggravating quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043909081', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1544587961}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a trippy, nerve-wracking and abrassive rouge-likes I've ever played. Everything about the aesthetic, to the difficulty, to the sound design and graphics are abrassive while being unique and really pleasing to look at and experience. It's a feast for the senses as it is for the mechanics. 

Heavy Bullets is the rougelike experience distilled to solid but simple mechanics and an equally simple premise. You're tasked with resetting the mainframe controlling the security systems of ... wherever in the hell you are, whilst dodging death and polygonial creature alike. 
There's one essence of permanency and that's in the money - you gain money from fragging monsters or contending with any of the rogue turrets or anything else you encounter in the maze - you can bank this for future attempts. There's also items like Life Insurance and Last will that'll perserve your items for the next run. It's very sparse on items but thwat's their serves their purposes well and keeps the loot pool from feeling overcrowded - a problem I find with many other games of this type. 

A big factor of games like this is also the difficulty, as of writing I haven't been able to conquer the maze but Iv'e gotten consistant at staying alive and banking money and buying suitable upgrades at around 4 hours of play-time so far, with my practice backing me up I haven't found many areas where the game was unfair. It's balanced as hell on top of it. 

The biggest detractor I can see is the high price point, at $10 the game still amounts to 8 levels in total and I've seen speedruns totaling out to mere minutes. It's absolutely a game recommended for those vested in the genre, or those willing to pick it up on sale - of which I had. Totally recommended under the circumstance of a sale, hell - I'd recommend it if your just looking for something new at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097295942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1684454396}
review: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this yet! This is a rouge-like FPS with perma-death, sure, but what does that feel like to play? Nerve-wracking, but also entrancing? The technicolor design is objectively garish, but never annoys. Dying ranges from hilarious to heartbreaking. Turn on one of those lofi hip-hop channels in the background, fix yourself a beverage, and play until you forget where you are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198862169565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1661820747}
review: If you like freaking the f*** out while passing around a corner because a cute beeping noise has become the voice of fast enemies rushing to munch your extremely limited health, this will be your new favorite game. Winding, colorful maze-like areas are crammed full of simplistic enemies that seem weak enough at first, but can easily fluster even those with pinpoint aim as their numbers grow. This game is heavily oriented towards money management, inventory management, testing aim, and punishing the player for making any mistakes. The rogue-lite aspects of this game make death less frustrating once the player learns which items will help between lives, but dying is still one of the most frustrating things in the world when not planned. For the price, the game is well worth it, and it's an instant buy if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146635403', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1540471790}
review:
눈 아프다. 

탄을 쏘면 탄피가 떨어지고 탄피를 먹으면 탄이 찬다. 조작은 빠른 편이다. 난이도는 처음에는 좀 어려운 듯하다가 할수록 할만 하다.  색감은 독특한데 눈 아프다.

적들이 죽으면 뱉어내는 코인으로 자판기에서 아이템을 사거나 저금을 하거나 등등을 할 수 있는데 초반에 돈 모아서 저금하고 죽고를 반복하며 어느정도 돈이 모이면 업그레이드를 하는 게 좋다. 그래야 좀 더 쉽게 플레이할 수 있지만 눈은 절대 편안한 게임을 즐길 수 없다. 

10500원 주고 살 게임이 아니다. 사지 않는 게 좋다. 인디게임에 대한 탐험욕을 이기지 못하겠다면 적어도 75퍼 세일은 해야 사줄만 하다. 절대 나쁜 게임은 아니다. 간단하게 즐기기 좋은 게임. 

아무튼 눈 아프다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012229279', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1619986972}

author: {'steamid': '76561198147612184', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1677906332}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a FPS roguelite that requires precise aim and careful shooting.

The main mechanic is your limited ammo. You start a run with only 6 bullets. The thing is, you can pick up your bullets after shooting them. You can buy more bullets from shops, but you're still going to want to be careful of how much you shoot.

Along with buying bullets from the vendors, you can buy things like health, items, and upgrades. Unfortunately, like every other FPS roguelite, this game has also had to choose between good gunplay or good run variety. There is little to no run variety in this game, even the level generation is lacking! Instead, it has some fantastic gunplay requiring more precision than anything else, and that's what makes it stand out from the other games.

I'd like to mention that depending on your PC, this title has some microstuttering issues, and most likely won't ever be fixed. I get the stutters, but they aren't too bad for me, yet others have it so bad it's unplayable. Your results may vary.

Grab it on sale, it's pretty dang fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1643039846}
review:
Tags: 1PS - First Person Shooter
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: No music. Samey repetitive corridors and gameplay loop. Limited ressources are like walking a tightrope for no payoff. Procedural.

This is a keycard corridor shooter with minimal branching paths and coins and dispensers. It is possible to unlock perks, but since everything is procedural and the grind is linear there is little incentive to go forward. Especially since the lack of asset variety gives you the distinct impression that you have seen the whole game 10 minutes in.

Conclusion: Could have had potential with the retro shooter movement, the simple aiming with manual revolver reloading. However the game just does not have enough meat around the bones to really sustain interest past a simple play session. For a minimalistic shooter with an improved level design and mechanics consider Superhot instead.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/690040/SUPERHOT_MIND_CONTROL_DELETE/

author: {'steamid': '76561197994068769', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1534559724}
review:
You have one gun, that's it, and as you play you learn that is not a bad thing.  
An assault rifle or shotgun would ruin the feel of this game.
There is a bank, so despite it being a "rouge like", even dying on the first level could be beneficial in the long run, if you saved some money you earned, giving you an advantage in the next game.

Absolutely great game for when you only have a short time to play.  I kill a half hour, or even just 5 minutes here or there with this game.  I love rouge likes, and it's not the masterpiece The Binding of Isaac is, but it's easily worth twenty bucks, works well with a controller or K+M, and can be learned quite quickly.  It's lacking depth, but that's kinda why i play it so much.  It's a pure test of reaction time and skill, not a test of knowledge (to go back to the binding of isaac, learning the game is a huge part, and a long, long process.  100's of items with no descriptions you have to figure out).  This is a good thing.  A "shallow" game is just what i want sometimes.  It's more like pacman and less like Rimworld.

My only complaint, and i mean only, i've thought about it quite a bit, is that this game is PERFECT for VR.
And, you know, it's not.  If this game was for VR, i would spend 100$ on it, and would probably have a thousand hours logged by now.  Seems like a seriously missed opportunity.

review:
Some fun stuff, graphics and gameplay, but awful random generated content, awfully hidden secrets and not enough content in terms of interesting items let you end this game on a bad note, if you want to beat it that is. I´m trying the enboss for the 4th time now, failed one time because the enboss is inside a small room stuffed with enemies and explosions, died two more times because I got unlucky [no health-stations before the endboss, no bank in the last level at all.] From the screenshots it might look like there is an interesting atmosphere, but this is not the case [arcady gameplay, lack of story, lack of music].
Fun if you play it for a bit, exhausting if you want to beat it.

[list]

[*]aesthetic is enticing
[*]audio cues are distinct and quick

Would like a texture pack to smooth the gradient on the wall but otherwise, love the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016747572', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1530026082}
review:
どんなゲーム？：
軽い操作のＦＰＳロークグライ。
操作感やリトライ性は高く、溜めたコインを銀行型自動販売機に貯めることで
序盤から強化していける

いいところ：
ランダムに変わるので毎回違って楽しめる
弾はいくつでも持てるが、６発しか込められず
うっかりリロードし忘れると痛い目を見る
音で敵の存在を察知できる
ボムで岩壊したり押すと開く隠し通路などがある

わるいところ：
アイテムに当たり外れがある。コイン自動回収アイテムとかタイムアタック向けのアイテムが出たときなんか・・・
コインを溜めないとすぐ死ぬ&死んだらバンク以外の所持品はロスト：
ロークグライっぽい要素で楽しいが、中ボス、ボスなどで即死パターンが多いので
リトライ、再挑戦までがしんどくなっている

草むらのミミズの何が恐ろしいってポーション持ってない時のポ

author: {'steamid': '76561198078623134', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1652352473}
review:
Its a kind of fun "rouge-like" or "rouge-light" FPS. It is very simplistic however, with only one gun, being the snubbnosed revolver. This gun is insta kill on basically all enemys as long as you hit the vulnerable spot, wich is where the difficulty comes from. As shown by the screen shots graphics are very spartan, in that there is little detail but they are serviceable and the aesthetic is certainly unique.

Despite the pseudo random levels i don't think it has too much replayability after you beaten the game, mostly as a result of the very repetative combat. There is a few items in the game for sure, but they are all unlocked from the start, so there is no real progression to be had in that sense. The items are not very active in combat either and i find that the most effective way to play is often to simply use the gun rather that anything else.
 You will get money from killing and selling things, wich you can use to buy upgrades and items. But these upgrades are often quite boring, being things like extra life, more ammo, magnets to attract bullets or coins and so on.

 I find it difficult to recomend it at full price considering how very repetative and simple the combat is, altough if you pick it up on sale it's worth a look in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980910801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1526345178}
review: Nothing about Heavy Bullets is downright offensive, but neither is anything particularly interesting. It's an FPS roguelite in which you recover and re-use the bullets you fire instead of getting ammo drops. That's really it. The music is minimalist, both in quantity and style. The graphics are primitive and garrish. Here's the kicker though: the game is full of bugs. On two completely different opperating systems, almost THREE YEARS apart, I've encountered the same exact microstuttering. I've lost rounds thanks to that-completley unacceptable. Even the options menu had bugs. Bugs like changing my resolution, or always defaulting to 4:3 monitors, or defaulting to windowed mode... EVERY TIME I start the game. Heavy Bullets just isn't finished and never will be. Conceptually, it's missing an identity. Physically, it's missing a boatload of polish. Buy a different game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012306547', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1990, 'last_played': 1579511383}
review:
シンプルなローグライクFPS
弾は最初6発しかないが撃った弾を回収して再利用できる仕組み
起動時の画面はガチャガチャうるさい割に
実際の探索時には無駄なBGMは存在せず、サイケな色使いと効果音とが相まって
ストイックな探索ゲーとしての雰囲気が作られており非常に好み

雑魚敵それぞれに特徴があるが理解すれば対処はしやすいため
ローグライクとしての判断能力の問われる場面や
システムの理解度からくる危機予測能力の向上の必要性などはそこそこでよく
FPS要素部分でのプレイヤースキルや慣れでどうとでもなる
まさに「ローグライクFPS」としてちょうどよいバランス

移動速度が早くてサクサク進めるカジュアルなプレイ感と
低体力の為雑にやるとすぐに死ぬシビアさが同居している
電子ドラッグみたいなスルメゲー
クリアしてからもなんか癖になって何度も潜ってました
ダンジョンクロウル系が好きな人にはとてもお勧め

author: {'steamid': '76561198000075616', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1681242692}
review: So, you want to buy the game. At first you will be asking questions like: why does this look like that one time i took that red pill? why caterpillars try to eat me? and did i fire six shots or only five? The truth is, only the last question matters. It's a fun, interesting take on the genre that will give you more fun than you expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1526147548}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a rogue-lite First Person Shooter FPS with neon art style
[*]The goal is simple: beat 8th level.
    [*]If you die, you go back to the first level. 
    [*]The game present hight variety of level generation with hidden secret rooms for additional loot.
    [*]The gameplay itself is quite fast so despite controller support I am reccomending playing this game with mouse and keyboard (like in oldschool shooters)
    [*]Main gameplay feature is your revolver and ability to pick up husk of your bullets to replenish ammo.
    [*]Additinally you collect money and spend it on 2 different vending machines (ammo/bombs and health/upgrades).
    [*]You can also use ATM's to sell items, deposit one item, withdraw or deposit money (money in ATM is kept in case of death)
  [*]Huge variety of enemies + two bosses: on 4th level and 8th level
  [*]One "full run" takes around 30-90 minutes 

This game is really good and core gameplay itself is fun yet I recommend this game with 50-75% discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162195614', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1596986698}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055607235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1524976254}
review: While I enjoyed the game, I can't recommend it, at least at full price.  Heavy Bullets is a solid rougelite.  It lacks depth a bit, but the gameplay is still good.  Two problems with it however, the lack of content, and the bugs.  Neither these is too bad, but seeing as the game was only enjoyable before, it brings it down quite a bit.  Content wise, you could finish it in 10h easily, and if you're used to games like this, 5h.  After you do finish it, theres very little replay value due to a lack of variation.  In terms of bugs, it can get pretty annoying at higher levels.  At low levels the worst you'll see is the occational case on an enemy seeing you through a wall.  Pretty easy to deal with due to the mechanics.  At higher levels, this becomes more frequent (due to the number of enemies) and much worse, you start lagging.  With the simple graphics and level design, this should not happen.  With the pace, and lack of room for error the game is built around, this is a death sentence, and can make the game unplayable.  As such, I can't recommend it, or at the very least, not at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216771803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1710119204}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090764771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1520540183}
review:
Heavy Bullets is an ultra simple, procedurally generated game in which your character has a six shooter with bullets you can pick up and reload after having shot them. Objective is to get through the randomized levels while enemies attempt to ambush you and bring your health down to zero. There's a few powerups and items that ephasize the randomization, but overall the game really isn't any fun and nothing of significance ever changes. I like recovering and managing bullets, but that exists in most games with crossbows.

Don't even bother with it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195229343', 'num_games_owned': 1600, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1672107515}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970550825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1524014409}
review:
I really enjoyed this game.

It's a simplified take on the roughlike genre, with neat graphics and a unique mechanic - your bullets persist in the world, so when you fire them, you can go and pick them back up. with a very limited number of bullets in your inventory, this makes firing each shot something you think about carefully.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983056185', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1522952867}
review:
There are much better procedurally generated FPSes, many of them for the same price or cheaper. This one's not worth the money because the lack of variety and compelling gameplay ended up boring me to death.

You creep around a sparse and boring procedurally generated level shooting anything as soon as you see it. There's only one environment type and the pseudo-80s color palate isn't enough to make it interesting. There's only a handful of monsters in the entire game, and while some are kinda creative, after you've killed your 100th one in a run that creativity isn't notable any more. The game's variety and strategy do get slightly better during the later levels, but not enough to make up for everything else.

You can't run and gun, but also at the same time there's somehow no real strategy or stealth--you move slowly down the one corridor forward until something sees you and then you shoot it. The random items aren't enough to make it less of a slog because they usually aren't special or useful enough for you to keep around, so you just hoard money until you find a vending machine on the boss level that sells the two or so items that you need for the fight and then you just repeat the creep-and-hoard gameplay until the next boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276974202', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1522550876}
review:
This is definitely a good game. There's something interesting and innovative about the ammo is handled. You can pick up the bullets that you fire, they essentially become a currency that keeps you alive.

The game is a cool rogue like. Where you can bank your money for future runs. Some encounters will require lightning fast reflexes, quick and accurate shots are going to get you far here. Seemingly every enemy goes down in a single hit. Some are camouflaged quite well in the bushes, some can block your shots, these little exploding bastards are by far the sneakiest ones. They look just like a plant, then sprint towards you.

In this game, you aren't the ultra bad ass aggressive hero, you'll be better served by playing defensively.

Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289460360', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1522863645}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987279127', 'num_games_owned': 5653, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1521168731}
review:
If you can buy this for $2.50 during a steam sale, this can be worth buying if:

A) You have twitch reflexes
B) You've played a rougue-lite before

If you do not meet the above 2 requirements, this game is not for you.

This game is pretty demanding, requiring you to make careful, sudden movements, and blast enemies very quickly before they can hit you.

I was able to beat in a half day, but I did look up some things online that I didn't understand after my first few deaths.  You should look up guides and tips online once you've died a few times - it will save you headaches later.

The final boss is really unfair, but fortunately there is an obnoxious way to "cheese" him.  Just look up "Heavy Bullets Final Boss" on youtube, after you've been annihilated by him once, and then you can steamroll him after looking up the stupid strategy.

review:
This game is a lot of fun. It is challenging and addicting. It's pretty fast paced and games last as long as you want them to. Overall fun and rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189148689', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1537629315}
review: this game makes my head hurt

author: {'steamid': '76561198027638961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1514263778}
review:
[b]TL;DR:[/b] This is a twitchy shooter with an ironic low movement acceleration. 
Gameplay loop is boiled down to two actions repeated over and over. Most items are useless. Enemy variety are practically reskins. And the "visual style" causes eye strain for me. Movement [b]feels[/b] heavy/slow. Bosses are unfairly overwhelming. Sound and music sucked.

Early game: Kite the enemies to pick one by one, snipe sentry batteries, step on worm mines to get damaged for free.

Endgame: Consists of flying garbage rushing you, and now there are sentries that walk towards you and giant ones that shoots explosive missiles and their battery can't be shot, it is turned off by going up to it and pressing "E".
Boss fights happen in a room full of clusterfudge that you can't retreat from. (double door closes behind you and a slowdown sentry holds you in place as soon as you open the next door)
(the level 8 boss I barely saw but looked like the same but with 3 times the enemy density, spammed over twenty bullets everywhere killed everything visible and got safe distance to analyse the situation, during the same second, a Suicide Bomb enemy killed me through the corner of the pillar I was hiding.

Most items are useless, pills lasts the time you get to leave the room where you found it, just carry a Last Will or golden potions (or both with a backpack).

Level design is garbage, just a bunch of preset corridors procedurally mashed together in a straight line, many many dead ends happen in junctions between corridor blocks.

The "artstyle" is just lack of talent and investment, spacial awareness suffers from that, constantly going back and forth making sure I wasn't forgetting anything, levels were tiny enough and previous gates lock behind you so, not much backtrack is possible but navigating is a pain in the behind. Slight eye strain from playing this.

I even stopped using the bank after my third playthrough, and got to the end boss. The first playthrough I died at the second level, getting the hang of the sensitivity and hitboxes. The second time I got to floor 5 and died to a snake mine right outside the start since I defeated the boss first try but lost heath figuring out where to shoot.

So the third time it was a cakewalk, got full coin magnet early on, a backpack and stockpiled 3 golden potions and 26 bullets total, never used anything else just blazed the entire game easy. damage was mostly garbage jumping at me through corners, Snake mines and failing to dodge turrets when the movement is awkward.

At level 7 I got bored and decided to rush in and oh boy, circlestrafing turrets makes them useless, but gets difficult to dodge normal rushing enemies, having quick fingers was not a problem but snake mines chip away health in this playstyle. When I ended up using one of the golden potions I went back to the boring "kiting rushers and poking turret batteries" default playstyle.

The enemy idle sound cues were the only thing design-wise they did right, but most sound effects I can do it myself better by pressing Randomize in BFXR (a free 8-bit sound generator), they all sucked along with the music, it was just background noise made in some trial version talentless wannabe artist, that I even forgot to put in the review and editing this in now.
Every time I got to the next level it "rewarded" me with the most jarring sound effect I ever heard for a level ending. 

By the way, it's been 45 minutes since I stopped playing and the eye strain still hurts, I knew it was possible but not this quick and as bad as "Dying Light chromatic aberration" bad.

Garbage game, I did not have the stutter every few seconds like most negative reviews but I had to disable some visual effects to reduce input lag, it was near impossible to play at default config first run, This game feels like it was an early acess made in Unity.

I have played better roguelites similar to this, not worth it at any price, will try to refund.
Thanks for reading. :wizard:

author: {'steamid': '76561198341353354', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1517548543}
review: 这个游戏真的是炒鸡好玩，非常有挑战性，刺激感非常棒棒哒！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1513532269}
review:
"Heavy Bullets" ist ein First-Person Roguelike-Shooter.

Die Welt ist anders, stylish, farbig-neon, mit flächigen Texturen bestückt. Wir haben nur einen Revolver in der Hand und der hat nur sechs Schuß. Gegnerische Viecher greifen uns auf Sicht an, Turrets schießen auf uns und treffen auch präzise, wenn wir nicht ausweichen.

Aber wie sollen wir mit nur sechs Kugeln überleben? Ganz einfach: indem wir unsere Geschosse wieder aufsammeln. Denn wir haben heavy bullets, Geschosse, die nachdem sie auf etwas treffen, einfach liegenbleiben. Darüßber hinaus können wir noch eine Spezialwaffe tragen, einen Dolch etwa für den Nahkampf oder eine Bombe zum werfen. Allerdings können wir nur eine einzige Spezialwaffe tragen. Oder ein Power-up, eine schnellere Bewegung etwa.

Besiegte Gegner hinterlassen ein paar Münzen, mit denen wir an Automaten  Gesundheit kaufen können oder mehr Patronen oder Spezialwaffen oder Power-ups. Wir könmen das Geld aber auch einzahlen, dann haben wir etwas für den nächsten Run. Denn sterben wir, dürfen wir wieder von vorne anfangen. Ganz von vorne. Ohne daß wir irgendwelche Verbesserungen behalten. Nur unser Geld ist noch abhebbar auf unserem Konto.

Die acht Level des Spiels werden bei jedem Run neu generiert. Zwar treffen wir immer im ersten Level nur auf einfache Gegner, aber die Anordnung der Räume und die Positionierung der Gegner ist jedesmal neu. Und die Gegner sind zwar nicht variantenreich, aber durchaus fordernd. Oft ist es ratsam, vorsichtig vorzugehen. Überhaupt hat das Spiel einen gehörigen Schwierigkeitsgrad, der auch mal zu Frustmomenten führen kann, insbesondere wenn man wieder und wieder bei Null anfangen muß.

Spaß macht es dennoch, denn das Spiel funktioniert mechanisch gut und direkt, hat einen klaren und gekonnten Stil und sogar die Sounds und die Musik passen ins stilistische Konzept. Ewig wird man das Spiel dennoch nicht zocken, dafür ist es zu abwechslungsarm und durch die zufällige Levelgenerierung auch oft zu glücksbasiert. Für einen Run zwischendurch ist es alledings immer zu gebrauchen.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
5/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Zwischendurch-Shooter. 

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

review: This is *one* of my favorite games. It is simple, but the one aspect of the game that persists each run (bank) is a neat idea. Beating it your first time is incredibly satisfying because on your way there you probably last more times than you can count on your fin gers and toes. But once you beat it once it becomes so easy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000833782', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1513157474}
review: Thought it would make a decent podcast game, but it's too reliant on audio cues to keep the sound muted, and not interesting or polished enough to play on its own. The style is good but it's too visually noisy for a fast-paced action game. Most of my deaths were simply because I couldn't see the enemies until it's too late. The shooting feels weak and sluggish, and none of the upgrades make your weapon better. I felt like I was stuck with the blaster from Quake 2 through the whole game, just a really slow and unsatisfying peashooter. The music feels randomly generated, and not in a good way. Has lots of neat ideas but it's not something I'll stick with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374343025', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1700498191}
review: To me Heavy Bullets seems to be the most fun modern arcade game. With its cool music and sometimes intens gameplay it is always fun to play.  Not to mention the fact the game is different every time because of the randomly generated levels. All and all I love the game and give it big thumbs up and would recomend it to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006735523', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1516647302}
review:
When I watched at the videos on internet I thought I would enjoy this game but I was wrong.

The maniability feels REALLY clumsy for a FPS. Especially a FPS with such cheap graphics. It feels like there is latency between my mouse and the game, like if the game was really poorly optimized. I thought that would be counter balanced with good feedbacks and dynamic fights and great maniability, but it's not really the case either.

EDIT : I fixed this issue by setting NO MAX FPS. However, I still have stutters (every X seconds the game completely freezes for 4 - 10 frames). It's incredibly annoying.

Also I found that there was a lot of unexplained features and items. That was probably a choice from the devs, but I don't find it very fun. I would rather go on internet and look for what item does what instead of experimenting myself. Since going on internet to look for such things is annoying, I think it would have been altogether much better with some description of the item in game, like in every other games.

Now I must say I didn't play much, around 30min, but I really don't feel like I would enjoy the game much more if I force myself to stick to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055612372', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1517599034}
review:
This is definitely worth your money. The game is almost the same as Killing Room and The Binding Of Isaac. Where you enter different rooms to kill monsters.

What is unique about this game is that it is that it is simplistic and is kinda like a maze in each room. It is not those kind of mazes where you have to encounter multiple dead ends to get to the next room, you can just walk right forward and find the entrance. But you can find potions and powerups in some of these dead ends.

The game has really simplsitic graphics and has good controls. You will like the consept and it should be really fun!
