author: {'steamid': '76561197970538611', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1631563725}
review: A below-average cyberpunk tactical rogue-like FPS. The big gimmick is that you have very limited ammo, but since every enemy only takes one shot to kill the novelty wears off pretty fast. Where it really falls apart is the poor balancing, confusing "let's throw way too many enemies at the player at once" for difficulty. I got tired of dying around level four or five every single time because of the traffic jam. I also didn't appreciate having to look up a guide to figure out what items did what. Why not have descriptions? It's not challenging, it's tedious. Pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042486456', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1511670031}
review: Constant FPS spikes render the game unplayable. Minimum settings, I can run League of Legends fine and WoW, but I can't run this game, with significantly lower requirements. You can literally stand there and do nothing, and every 10s or so, FPS drops to 1 for 500-1000ms. It's not possible to play a fast-paced game like that. There was a popular review which highlighted this issue, but it's off the front page now. It said that the dev commented on the issue and said they can't fix it. The dev should find the patch which introduced the regression, and fix it. It's basic, first year comp sci level stuff.

review:
The perfect gaming snack.

A fast paced, random generated dungeon crawler with simple* graphics.

Start, fight, get killed, start again, be happy if you make it to dungeon level 2 or even further and die again.
All that within minutes.

Perfect to reset your brain.


*simple graphics does not realy do the game right.
But writing "abstract aesthetics that actually add to the game's challenge by breaking your viewing habits" would have been to long.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970775310', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1511440590}
review:
Another one of those underappreciated games. It's not big on story or character building, but for what it lacks in those areas, it makes up for in pure rouge-like challenge and randomness. And let's not forget the best part: them heavy heavy bullets!

Pros
- Fast paced and challenging gameplay
-Unique ammo system (You can go pick up your old bullets, but you don't have very many.)
- Very randomized maps with lots of possible secrets.
- Easy as hell to run on most computers
- Simplistic and retro art style that still remains interesting to look at.


Cons
-You aren't playing it yet
- VERY fast and sometimes annoyingly hard to detect enemies.
-F!#%#NG snakes. (Watch those bushes.)
- Hard to tell what most power ups do until you use them.
- Takes a while to get used to the default controls (mostly for powerup use)
- No saving, you die, you go right back to the start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006077632', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1528084851}
review:
[h1]"Welcome to High Rise Hunting Grounds: A Safe Place to Kill"[/h1]
[i]- You're in for an adventure[/i]

Heavy Bullets has been haunting me rather successfully since 2015, but since I recently beat the new game that the creator had time to make in the interim, I decided to go back and smother this helpless baby once and for all.

It's a roguelite. Lite because it doesn't match some arbitrary criteria that some people, who are very mad that the Nethack wiki exists, came up with, but I'd be attempt to slot it under there anyway. All the roguelike elements, brimming on the surface like fecal matter at a water processing plant alongside Action-Adventure and RPG elements, just aren't very good. They're about as bad as that analogy.

So for the premise, the corporate hunting ground -  this time not solely referring to the process of hiring and firing - has been solidly buggered and you, a janitor, and about 10-20 other janitors depending on how good you are at the game, have been tasked with going down 8 levels to sort out this ruckus at the source. You're signing a liability waver first, they don't expect you to make it back.

Don't worry, they give you a gun. Save a bullet for yourself.

Yes, it's got a nice sense of humour about the whole thing, although most of it is simply confined to condemning this completely fictional practice that the developer made up, and isn't quite as fun as the short conversational logs where they take what's left of that water processing plant by the gallon. Complete with emoticons. Ingame it's just snide comments.

[h1]"High Rise are like terrible."[/h1]
[i]- Common saying in the secret rooms. More like secret cabinets.[/i]

Something the developer realised, because High Hell has roughly the same slant with a much better emphasis on humour. 

Whole lot of that trend here. Heavy Bullets, for all its flaws or depth or whatever close approximation of either it can muster, is just a bit of a step down compared to High Hell. Which is a good thing by all accounts, and not just because I'm heavily biased against procgen. Getting better with each game is a good thing, I'd say. 

So the gameplay involves walking through a series of randomly generated rooms - "randomly generated" meaning pre-existing stitched-together tilesets - filled with the lamest items the developer could muster. It just has an absolute lust for giving you a series of scopes and pointy helmets like the Cursed Gem that makes all your bullets explode isn't blatantly the most fun item in the game. 

Other than that you're just collecting cash to spend on the same pool of buffs and items, so not much to surprise you. It's threadbare and weaker for it, unless you really like the idea of continually running through the game until RNGesus blesses you with the items needed for that LOOK AT ALL THOSE HEARTS achievement. Not my thing. I mean I did it anyway, but I wouldn't recommend it.

So that's weak. But it's really the core gameplay that carries Heavy Bullets.

You start off weak. Panicky. Crawling around corners, abusing line of sight, and shooting at every potential snake-bush twice. After just one or two successful runs, you're a screaming Olympic-Athlete, feet drenched in the dregs of reused bullets and circle-strafing/firing blindly at every opportunity. It easily is a game that gets better the more you play it.

[i]Protip: Pre-first win, bomb banks for some nice starter coin. Rocks can just be shot with 3 or 4 bullets to break them, bombs are for banks.[/i]

But that first few couple of runs are incredibly weak and this was easily set up to be a negative review before crawling over the line.

Honestly, I would say to go check out the Developer's newest game High Hell if you're in the market for this, apart from being sadly much slower movement-wise it's just got all the pieces this doesn't. But if you are in the market for this:

It's a bite-sized okay roguelike that's happy for you to play it. Not much to say other than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267284353', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1587807144}
review:
シンプルで難しいFPSを求めるならこれ以上のものはない。
ストーリーはほぼ皆無。いきなりフィールドに放り出される潔さは好き。

コントラストがはっきりしているグラフィックと大きめの的により、瞬間的に敵の位置を把握しやすく、且つ一撃必殺の銃でパパンと小気味良く薙ぎ倒していく爽快感がこのゲームにはある。
その反面、弾は沢山持てるものの、銃が6発しか装填できない上、一発ずつ自分で装填しなくてはならないシステムなため、残弾数の把握と無駄撃ちしない冷静さが問われるシビアな面も持つ。
また、基本的にBGMが無く静かなため、若干ホラーゲーム寄りな雰囲気でもある。

ローグライクの醍醐味であるPermadeath(恒久的な死)のシステムは、緊張感が生まれる反面一度死ぬとやり直す気が起きにくくなる弊害があるが、預けることでお金やアイテムを次周に引き継げる救済措置のおかげで、苦手な人でも再挑戦しやすい環境が用意されており、好感が持てる。

アイテムは多くても2種類しか持って行けないので、何を拾うか何を選ぶかを考えるのも一興。
強力でリスクのあるアイテムとも上手く付き合うことで思わぬ活路を見いだすことができるのも良い。

ボスが固定なので慣れるとつまらないが、それでも初っぱなのボスは強い。
対策しないとあっさり死ぬので毎度手に汗握る。

タイムアタックはやはりローグライクと相性がいい。
実績解除の達成感はひとしおなので是非挑戦すべし。

不満点としては
タレット型の敵が起動しながら発射してくることがあるのが気に入らなかった。
ドアを開けた時に不意を突かれることが多く、ちょっと不快。
一部の実績はアイテムを決められた数回収することで得られるものであるが、1周のうちに拾い切れるかは完全に運なので周回がかったるいこと。

シンプル・イズ・ザ・ベストを感じさせる良作品です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198394336550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1678208218}
review:
The review for Heavy Bullets was the first review I ever wrote on this platform, and it aged poorly. Allow me to do this game justice.

Heavy Bullets is a combination of rogelite and twitch reflex shooter. 99% of enemies die in one hit, and make a very distinct "I've noticed the player!" sound. The alert noise for the Imp is forever seared into my memory. Anyway, your objective is to make your way through an abandoned hunting complex. You start off with a couple bombs, a revolver, and... six bullets. That might not seem like much, but that's where the game's unique mechanic comes in: Your gun fires truly massive rounds. Not only do they literally shatter foes like glass, they're so incredibly heavy that once they hit something, they fall to the ground, where you can pick them up and re-use them. It's a very simple mechanic, sure, but it's interesting nonetheless. 
Combine this with some funky enemies, clean low-poly visuals, great sound design and a plethora of interesting items and you've got a real gem on your hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017163400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1652154683}
review: Heavy Bullets is confusing at first, but after you spend some time with it, the elegance of its minimal design choices become apparent. I find it especially difficult, but like another procedurally generated game I love, Spelunky, it is deeply rewarding. The visual presentation in particular is strikingly clean and refreshing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003822853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1507459551}
review:
I will freely admit that I no longer want to bother with games that taunt me with their "difficulty".

I know, that isn't a popular sentiment, but the truth it's just a fad and eventually good design will come around again.


Heavy bullets, while flying that banner upon which is written the latin for "git gud", is actually appallingly fun. I do not feel restricted by the games design, the controls manage to betray a "protagonist" that, while faceless, is able. And I genuinely feel i have no body else to blame for my failures. The game teaches you in the same way that one might expect the kung-fu master to rear his brash pupil. You'll take damage the first time you step on a snake, you might even get poisoned, but you'll watch out for those god-damned bushes next time.

Heavy Bullets actually makes me feel that frenetic pulse quickening moment when I step into new rooms and hear the individuals battle cries of several enemies at once, but I know, that I am quick enough and with a little luck I might be able to get a grenade in there.

Don't be fooled, however, this game is still elementary. The building blocks you come up against do not come in many flavors, but their use if artful enough that you shouldn't mind through a few good playthroughs, and their is a actually a semi-deeper story stowed away among the props.

Edit: Since it has come up twice, I don't mean difficulty and good design are mutually exclusive. I suppose my issue is with games that immediately posture as having a high difficulty but instead of bothering with good controls or tricky situations that savvy players may overcome they become mired in ruinous, frustrating controls and dodgy hit detection. I have no interest in ferreting out issues in a game that the creators could not be bothered with themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995619015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1653236224}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997335747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1522518187}
review:
In an gaming era filled with first-person shooters Heavy Bullets does a great job of standing out above the crowd.  In most shooters you can unload clip after clip into to enemies with an array of weapons in your arsenal.  In this game thats not an option.  The revolver is the only weapon available and it comes with a mere six bullets.  You'll need to collect your bullets after firing them and individually reload them back into the cylinder.  If that wasn't daunting enough be aware this is a procedurally generated roguelike.  When you die you will lose everything on you and have to start from the very beginning.  Read on to find out if you're up to the challenge.

On each floor you'll find enemies, shops, banks, items, and locked rooms.  There are a variety of enemies from snakes hidden in the grass, spiders that can guard their bodies, to turrets that shoot out lasers and bombs.  You can use money dropped by dead enemies in the shops which can sell both items and upgrades.  Some upgrades can help you attract coins/bullets, some let you carry more of the same item, while others let you reload multiple bullets at the same time.  One time use items include weapons like bombs, mines, and rockets.  Other items offer passive effects much like the upgrades.  You can sacrifice a key card to open locked rooms and grab the random item within.

The mapping of the floors is different each time you play but they all basically feel likes narrow mazes with a couple openings here and there.  A series of doors break the floors into bite-size chunks to help give you a sense of progression.  Also, its important to know once a door has been open for a extended period of time lasers will stop you from going back for items or shops.  The maps aren't particularly pretty, their neon rainbow walls serve more of a practical purpose to help distinguish hazards than anything else.  The rest of the art is more cartoony with a lot of simple textures and polygons.  The art isn't awful but seems like its purely there to serve the gameplay rather than standout in its own right.

Caution and and steady aim is key to survival.  Audio ques are honestly just as important as visual ques as each threat will make a noise as its about to attack.  Some enemies even generate noise standing still, warning you that danger is right around the corner.  With such limited ammo its crucial to take your time, even just a second, to line up your shots right the first time.  You can quickly find yourself out of bullets and in the bigger rooms in can be especially dangerous to track them down.  Enemies move and shoot quickly so its best to take them on one at a time when possible.  Half the enemies will follow you allowing you to fall back and let them come to you.

This is just a wonderfully unique rogue-like that will keep you coming back for more.  It feels a lot like Spelunky with both the way the levels are laid out and in the sense of each death is a lesson.  Even with the procedural generation the game rarely feels unfair.  Its easy to get into a tight spot if you're not careful but if you take you time you shouldn't go through you're health too fast.  Just don't jump into Heavy Bullets expecting much visually as the gameplay was clearly the focus.  The bland looking levels get old pretty fast but thankfully the gameplay is fun enough to keep you hooked.  Fans of shooters and/or rogue-likes need to do themselves a favor and try out the uniquely crafted experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067359292', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1501285843}
review:
Its a good rogue like shooter.

The game colors make everything look different, the game is simple but reaching the final boss will take you a few retries, there is secret items, regular items and a bunch of enemies that will make things difficult on you.

Also it seems the game spawns harder enemies if it notices you are getting powerful items sooner (for example having the explosive bullets item right at the start) which makes it more interesting and not as repetitive.

I have seen reviews of people complainig about bugs, glitches or slow dows but I got to say I didnt experiment them during my game play other than very rarely an enemy skipping one wall.

Its fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198003274398', 'num_games_owned': 3745, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1500095625}
review:
弱鸽like 风格的第一人称射击，特别适合对自己枪法有自信的 独(抖)狼(M) 型选手进行挑战。
偏硬核，特色的"打出的子弹必须自己捡回来" 的设定，决定了每一步、每一枪都必须小心谨慎。

[油断一秒、怪我一生] 就是形容这样的游戏吧= =

+第一人称射击，地图随机生成
+敌人种类也算丰富
+各种随机与隐藏要素

-卡墙角可以解决80%+的敌人= =
-对于手残型选手太不友好

[spoiler]
存档位于注册表
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\TerriVellmann\HEAVY BULLETS
如果真手残的不行。。也可以S/L大法备份存档，一层一层稳扎稳打
点到为止= = 还不会的话欢迎询问
[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198107433421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1522513230}
review:
Positif : 
-design minimaliste mais intéressant, 
-gameplay bien calibré qui joue sur les réflexes.

Négatif : 
-musique qui va et qui vient sans raison apparente, 
-gameplay qui pénalise le backtracking dans un niveau (alors que le jeu aurait pu jouer à fond la carte du doom-like)
-et SURTOUT : un bug dont je n'ai pas pu déterminer l'origine (jouer avec uniquement steam qui tourne, sans téléchargement, rien n'y fait), et qui cause des micro-freezes à chaque fois qu'on tire... Dans un jeu qui joue à fond sur les réflexes et un temps de réaction très court, 0.2-0.5sec de lag à chaque tir, c'est simple : c'est in-jou-able! 

Le jeu est sympa mais ne m'avait pas emballé; avec le bug en plus, désinstallation sans remord. Ceux qui ont la chance de ne pas avoir les freezes pourront peut-être y trouver leur compte malgré tout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055705033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1495739543}
review:
In theory, Heavy Bullets has everything it takes to be an exemplary FPS Roguelike - permadeath, randomly generated levels,  upgrades and somewhat original resources management. I tried it, because it was presented as a game similar to my beloved Tower of Guns and Paranautical Activity. 

But it doesn't have fast paced gameplay of Paranautical, or ToG's amazing design. Some may consider HB graphics artistic or beautiful for it's simplicity, but for me it was just cheap. Gunplay is almost non-existing, because in most cases (except for turrets) we can see enemies from long distance and the best strategy is to stand still, and wait until they are so close, you can't miss. You have limited amount of bullets, but it rearly does happen to run out of them in a fight, moreover, you can pick up fired bullets, which makes this mechanism just redundant.
And there is an upgrade system. Unfortunatelly, you can carry only one item at the time, there are no separated slots for passive and active upgrades. In fact, you can't upgrade your charactem much more, than increasing life points and number of bullets (which in fact doesn't matter).

It's not a bad game. It's just not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975051410', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1483770096}
review:
The game is fun if you are one of the lucky people to not have the "frame loss bug."   The graphics are from 10 generations ago, so this could run on your dusty Ipod picture that is in your mom's attic.  Unfortunately, a bug came out of no where that causes people, including myself, to lose 5 or so frames every few seconds.  This is a fast pace game, and the frame loss is a game killer.  I was able to play my first ten or so hours with no problem, then the bug started with no change to my setup.

People have posted all sorts of specs, and the dev has tried but failed to fix the bug.  He even stated in the forums that some things just can't be fixed, and he's sorry that some people can't play it.... Kinda lame but I can't blame him.

If you don't have the game, try it.  If you get random frame loss, refund it.  The game itself is great, so I will give  it a thumbs up, even though those of us with the bug are SOL

author: {'steamid': '76561198043693378', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 1430, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1520, 'last_played': 1481926755}
review:
Usually I don't like rogue-likes, because they are random, unfair and boring.
Well this one isn't boring at all, at the beginning (first 5-10 hours or so), it feels very unfair, later on you will learn how the game works and it gets enjoyable. But the rng aspect can always kick your asss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045234840', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1589661788}
review: A short but neat game, pick it up when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072680595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1498919099}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a great rogue-like fps that has two unique features that sets it apart from the rest. 
The gameplay is mostly the standard run and gun style that most games in the genre have. What makes it unique is the fact that the player has to reuse the bullets. After a bullet is fired the player will need to pick it up again. Thats a good thing because the player will have 6-8 bullets on average. 

This makes for fun and frenetic action as a player needs to rush past enemies to get his ammo back. 

The level design are good most of the time, although there will be a unfair level since the levels are randomly generated. The levels also lacks any verticality since every level is on one floor. There are no stairs, dips or inclines. 

The other unique aspect of the game is the presentation. The graphics are low-fi. The levels are low texture and low poly. The enemies are also low poly and kind of ugly. This style actually benefits the game since they are appealing to a certain degree and help the game stand out. The sound is also mostly a series of beeps and boops. 

The rest are all standard fair. Perma-death. Items. Banking money for the next run. High difficulty. The game is still worth a try since it will give a player a unique gameplay experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113218224', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 43042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 558, 'playtime_at_review': 6746, 'last_played': 1712366687}
review: According to my stats, I've played this for over 118 hours.  It remains one of my go-to games even though I've been killed a great great many times!  It's high energy.  It's high action.  But it's also very stratigic and engages all your thought processes.  I'm not sure just what keeps me coming back.  Somewhere it's about outgunning monsters, outwitting them and surviving to tell the tail that holds the fascination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095067344', 'num_games_owned': 2157, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1460010532}
review:
As a disclaimer, I haven't put much time into this game nor have I come anywhere close to beating it, but I figured I'd recommend it since I do enjoy it.
Heavy Bullets is a rogue-lite game where you progress through floors while killing monsters and trying not to die. The gimmick is that you can pick up your bullets after you fire them. This makes it so you go into each fight with a very limited amount of ammo, so you need to place your shots well. This can be hard when you get jumped by something hiding in a bush and start to panic fire. It's difficult, but very well designed and feels fair. When I die I know that it was because I messed up or wasn't paying attention. There is permadeath, but you can save some of the money you get in each run in your bank. I also love the atheistic of the game with all the neon colors.
I feel like I've only scratched the surface of the game, and would say that it's worth the $10 they're asking for. But do keep a look out for the game going on sale as it seems to do that quite often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008580123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1576003065}
review:
Randomly generated ROGUE FPS.
Randomly generated colorful FPS where You have just a gun (and sometimes even a knife!) and soooooooooooo heavy bullets, that You've to pick them after any shot, becuase You don't have any other ammunution.
It is surprisingly a very good fast paced strategic shoot out. Because You are not alone in this randomly generated maze. There are enemies (damn fast ones or tricky ones), security systems and even bosses.
Only thing on your sides are vending machines where can You buy upgrades for your gun, life, backpack, life insurance... truly... life insurance too : )
So... this is a good game when You have just a little time and You want an escalating challenge where the fast reflex and precision is the key.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1495718583}
review:
素のエイムぢからや丁寧なカッティングパイが活きる、プレイヤースキルへの依存度が高いFPS型のローグライクゲー。全8ステージで4と8にはボスが居る。

銃は6発しか装填できず、弾も最初6発しか持っていない。幸い何かに当たって落ちた弾は拾って再利用できるので、一発一発大事に篭めて撃つ緊張感がいい。

銀行に預金できる、生命保険が掛けられる、入手したアイテムを持ち越す遺書が買える、以外の引き継ぎ要素はなし。

ステージが進むほど同じアイテムが高額になっていくので、預金するだけの捨てプレイをして次回序盤で買い漁るっていう方法で難易度の引き下げは可能だが、腕とドロップ運次第で手ぶらで行ってもクリアは可能。

面白いけどチープゲー枠だし変化のバリエーションが少ないので、100時間遊べますって類ではないね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023441855', 'num_games_owned': 3610, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1495584067}
review:
Heavy Bullets, prima ancora di essere un FPS, è un prodotto di arte concettuale. L'essenza dello shooter nei suoi elementi distintivi è catturata con una fredda precisione e presentata in una forma quasi prototipale: spogliata della totalità degli elementi superflui ciò che rimane è l'idea stessa di FPS, in cui il gameplay semplice ma tecnicamente esigente rappresenta la sola ed unica chiave di lettura.

In Heavy Bullets dovremo farci largo tra strane creature aggressive e sistemi di difesa malfunzionanti percorrendo un labirinto dagli abbaglianti colori fluo, fino a raggiungere e resettare il mainframe situato all'ottavo ed ultimo piano: una "trama" che definire tale sarebbe una bestemmia, ma la stessa natura essenziale del titolo ci impone di stare al gioco e chiudere un occhio su questo aspetto.

Per tutta la durata della partita l'arma a nostra disposizione sarà sempre la stessa: un semplice revolver a 6 colpi. La particolarità della pistola sta nella gestione delle munizioni: avremo infatti a disposizione un normale tamburo da 6 colpi (cha dovremo ricordarci di caricare singolarmente), ma i proiettili sparati potranno essere raccolti e riutilizzati. Tutto ciò, unito alla scarsità di proiettili sostitutivi, imporrà una maggiore precisione di tiro, rendendo il gameplay molto meno frenetico e molto più ragionato rispetto al FPS medio a cui siamo ormai abituati.

Come in ogni roguelite che si rispetti, i labirinti da percorrere sono generati randomicamente ad ogni partita, e una volta esaurita l'energia vitale il gioco terminerà definitivamente. Ad alleviare parzialmente le nostre fatiche potremo trovare nei meandri del dedalo dei power-up sotto forma di oggetti consumabili o passivi; gli stessi oggetti potranno essere acquistati più facilmente da uno dei tanti distributori automatici, a patto di avere raccolto sufficienti monete d'oro dai nemici sconfitti. Saltuariamente potremo imbatterci in una sorta di terminale simil-Bancomat con cui potremo depositare somme di denaro, rendendole così disponibili per una run successiva, o prelevare denaro da nostro conto: un espediente da me personalmente gradito, che funziona bene come money-dump nelle fasi avanzate del gioco, in cui spesso ci capiterà di accumulare più monete di quante ne riusciremo a spendere.

Lato audio-video, come anticipato in apertura, vige una sobrietà quasi surreale che poco o nulla lascia all'immaginazione. Tutti gli elementi della scena, dalla nostra arma ai nemici passando per gli elementi decorativi (pochissimi) sono rappresentati da modelli poligonali estremamente primitivi, mentre la colonna sonora è praticamente assente e gli effetti audio a tratti sembrano uscire direttamente dal mio vecchio modem 56k U.S. Robotics (punti bonus per questo).

Heavy Bullets NON è un gioco per tutti. Non tutti infatti riusciranno a sopportare a lungo un aspetto grafico e un gameplay così basici senza farsi sopraffare dall'esigenza di maggiore varietà e contenuti: nella mia breve esperienza tuttavia ho trovato in Heavy Bullet un gioco stimolante ed impegnativo al pari di alcuni vecchi arcade, e mi sento quindi di consigliarlo a tutti gli amanti dei FPS alla ricerca di un'esperienza di gioco fuori dagli standard.

[i][b]Se questa recensione ti è piaciuta clicca "Segui" sulla [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/retrogamingcafe/curation]pagina del Curatore[/url] del mio gruppo: sarai sempre aggiornato con i miei personali consigli e le recensioni dei migliori titoli indie/retro/roguelite in circolazione![/b][/i]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198032056050', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1605207972}
review: A great game to pick up and spend a weekend playing, Heavy Bullets is what every roguelike FPS should try to be: a game that rewards many playstyles in interesting ways. From the slow methodical approach to the quake-like run and gun, every playstyle has items that back it up, but aren't powerful enough to do anything but support you. There aren't any items in this game that could be considered a 'crutch' or a 'run-winner' in contrast to other roguelikes such as The Binding of Isaac where runs are heavily affected by what items you find. In Heavy Bullets it's largely up to you to conserve your health and hit your shots accurately. This game rewards skill quite heavily, allowing you to attempt to make skillful decisions to get yourself out of a rough situation, such as shooting enemy rockets or grenades out of the air. All of this sounds great on paper, however the way the camera moves in this game can sometimes be rather sluggish and other times seem a bit too fast, and the game itself is rather poorly optimized, I often get dips in FPS in the later levels which can greatly interfere with my aim when it happens. Other than that, I believe the pros of this game greatly outweigh the cons.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999852966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1484975459}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064833939', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1503858497}
review:
[h1]Heavy Bullets isn't a bad game. At least I don't think it is...[/h1]

Heavy bullets isn't a particularly innovative game, nor is it a game of depth. What you see in your first playthrough is, to my knowledge, what the whole game consists of -- and that's not a bad thing. The gameplay is fast-paced but basic, with the ability to pick up bullets being the only thing that I would consider to be an unusual trend for a roge-like/lite game. money must be managed well, and there are no checkpoints. All pretty standard, albiet enjoyable stuff.

The MASSIVE con to this game is the glaring issue of regular stuttering. My rig, along with the vast majority of players', well exceeds the minnumum requirements, but regardless, consistent stuttering is a consistent problem. Because of this (deabably) game-breaking bug and the dev's lack of interest in patching it, I simply cannot reccomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983660276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1680725486}
review: It's an interesting FPS that kind of makes you feel like you're in 1980s movie-esque virtual reality. There are a number of items you can pick up, both weapons and tools, as well as the ability to sell things and buy equipment as well as extra health, etc. There are a few monsters and a few automatic laser turrets as enemies, it's basically just trying to get as far as you can before you die. You can also buy 'insurance' and make a bank account so you don't lose all the money you make. The most negative thing about this game is feeling too cocky and trying to rush through at ease only to walk over some plants and get killed by a poisonous worm thing or something making you lose all. I often find my self yelling "SON OF A WHORE," then deciding to call it a day. It's a pretty decent and interesting concept for an FPS, it's fairly cartoony but not overly so, ie when you shoot bullets they kill an enemy then bounce until you walk over them to which you can put them back in your gun. This can keep you on edge because if you don't make a habit of buying extra bullets (which aren't in a pack but single) or picking up your bullets, and quickly reloading, you will find yourself quite screwed as enemies do rush at you, and can often swarm. I really don't know what else to say about this game off the top of my head other than if this were a PSP game, that would freaking be amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964520748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1660133068}
review:
The game COULD be fun, but it's absolutely ruined by random stutters which, due to the breakneck pace this game progresses, will often lead to instant death forcing you to restart the game. Judging by my more than capable hardware, and what I've read in the forums, this issue is not an isolated case and appears to be quite prevalent. A fix will not be coming because the dev has abandoned it.

Buy only if you have more dollars than sense ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044983093', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1641925472}
review:
[h1]A fresh take on roguelike dungeon crawling, with hidden depth[/h1]

An indoor hunting grounds complex has been hacked, and the turrets are now as hostile as the weird wildlife. As one of many disposable janitors, you've been assigned to go through the eight floors and clear them until you reach the mainframe and reset it.

Your giant revolver shoots oversized bullets that you then go and pick up and use again. That means each shot has to count. It also means if you shoot an enemy far away, you have to walk over there to pick up the bullet.

You'll be dying a lot. Being the dedicated employee that you are, you can collect the gold coins that enemies drop and stash them in ATMs  so the next poor sucker has a better chance of purchasing upgrades and clearing more floors.

Taken at face value, Heavy Bullets is a simplistic roguelike FPS. But once you've played a few lives, you start seeing the depth of the gameplay. I'm not experienced with roguelikes and usually I don't like them much, but it's all about playing the long game. Giving each run your best shot, but also planning ahead in case you don't make it all the way.

You'll be finding or purchasing upgrades such as a coin or bullet vacuumer, spare bullets, rockets, an Aliens-style motion detector, speed boots, health potions and much more. You have to decide whether to hoard your gold or go all out. Maybe you'll do a few "farming" runs where you just stash as much gold as possible, and then do a proper run to clear the game. And since you can only carry one special item with you at a time (unless you get the Backpack upgrade), you have to decide what to keep and what to dump.

One negative is performance. Mostly the game runs butter smooth, but despite the simple graphics I get a random stutter every now and then, on my GTX 980. Doesn't make sense, and can ruin an entire run in game like this that relies on split-second reflexes.

Also, watch out for the snakes in the bushes. Those fucking snakes.

I loved this game. It's quick, simple, and yet allows for strategy. I like the visual style. The music and sound effects are awesome. It's definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037940704', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1477954822}
review:
Heavy Bullets
Now, to be quite honest, the first time I saw this, I fell in love with this game, because it was simply a pretty easy game and then I tried to get good at it, almost beat the game until I misclicked.
Now, this was maybe, 2-3 years ago.

Now, the game itself lags at certain intervals and when the core gameplay of this game is based on quick reactions, it becomes near unplayable. The other bad part is, this game becomes progressively laggier the more you progress into the levels, becoming extremely stuttery at the last level. I used to love this game, now I can't even look at it.

I would have recommended this game forever ago, but now I cannot.
My other point in this review, I upgraded my setup from when I had it prior 2 years ago where i didn't have a single problem. So something isn't right when a game runs worse on a higher end graphics card.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032017546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1483667797}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035718532', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1480645083}
review: This game manages to feel as nauseatingly close-up as DOOM, even though it has a fully developed 3D engine. The visuals are an assault of neon textures without any lighting or distinction between what's a wall,prop, or opening to another room. If you like motion sickness and wandering around a floor for long periods of time trying to figure out where the next room is, (because the hallways have no lighting and usually look like walls) then this is the game for you

review:
[h1][b]Heavy Bullets Review Headline To Grab Your Eyes[/b][/h1] 
It has fast pace gameplay, appealing graphics, good soundtrack, fun difficulty, and with rogue-lite features to top it off.

Though it does have its problem some being fps stuttering; minimal to a lot depending on the graphics card and the standard turrets seen ingame seem a bit too trigger happy.

But besides that it's a great game to play for a few hours if your bored or 10+ if you absolutely [b]love[/b] it, [strike][i]which is not me of course.[/i][/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198173495566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1570258659}
review:
Tras la agridulce experiencia dejada por Paranautical Activity, decici probar Heavy Bullets, y confieso que este juego esta mucho mejor trabajado en varios aspectos.
La forma de recargar las balas, eso si, es un poco confusa. En lugar de recargar todas las balas de una vez, hay que recargar una por una. Esto no es malo, al contrario, puede ser hasta muy disfrutable.
La ambientacion, el diseño artistico, incluso hasta los sonidos, me parecieron excelentes, y a pesar de no tener jefes de nivel, si tiene un nivel de dificultad que te obliga a tener cierta estrategia antes de avanzar, porque en cada esquina hay enemigos listos para atacarte.
Hablando de los enemigos, mas de una vez me di un susto de muerte por culpa de las serpientes que estan bien ocultas entre algunos arbustos, por lo que recomendaria andar con cuidado y no confiarte en el momento en que veas algun objeto interesante frente tuyo.
¿El unico contra de este juego? Los controles in-game son los mismos que usas en los menus (¿Que?), por lo que recomendaria al desarrollador trabajar un poco en ese asunto. No es algo que afecte al juego por completo, solo quiero recalcarlo para cualquiera que quiera comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057976534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1484087189}
review: I bought it for 2.50 and I couldn't be happier.  "fps spelunky" is a reach.  It's a good game and will give you at least an hour or two of entertainment.  I spent the about an hour and the "rouge like" aspect never really got brought into it.  It was more "Learn how to avoid cheap deaths!" (which I guess does make it like spelunky...) I recommend just because the mechanics are tight and you can spend some time loving it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992903346', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1657224346}
review:
Es posible que entre entre mis rogue-likes preferidos. Siempre lo juego con algún podcast de fondo o algo mientras intento pasar los niveles.

Es posible que tenga un punto negativo este juego (o tal vez simplemente no se me de bien el juego): No he conseguido acabarlo en las más de 30 horas que lo he jugado (es cortito). He conseguido llegar al boss final, pero me parece injusto en cuanto a dificultad dicho boss.

Aun conociendo el punto negativo, sigo recomendando este juego porque cumple a la hora de engancharte matando los diferentes enemigos que te encuentras en los niveles generados aleatoriamente. :)

Dejo un gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o2od9_351RE

author: {'steamid': '76561198045463316', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1598679455}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001956540', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1477602116}
review:
È un rogue-like 3D come tanti. Non innova un granchè nel genere e soprattutto introdue un enorme mucchio di stronzate.
Parliamo della struttura del gioco:
1) Le basi
[list]
[*]Come in ogni rogue-like, ad ogni partita rinizi da 0
[*]Ci sono vari livelli. Ogni livello è composto da un labirinto e varie stanze
[*]Hai a disposizione un numero limitato di proiettili. I proiettili possono però essere recuperati (come se fossero delle freccie)
[*]È possibile depositare i soldi guadagnati in una partita per poterli utilizzare in una futura partita (ma solo quando si trova la banca)
[*]ci sono vari oggetti che danno effetti attivi e/o passivi
[/list]
2) Il gameplay vero e proprio
Siete in un labirinto, tutto è super lowpoly e colorato in maniera molto strana. I primi nemici che probabilmente incontrerete saranno molto facili da distinguere, in quanto saranno neri (quindi un grande contrasto).
Poi vi capiterà sicuramente di camminare sopra una pianta e di perdere vita. Vi chiederete il perchè di tutto questo, e vi accorgerete che nascosto in una delle mille piante che avete già visto prima questa volta c'era una sottospecie di verme carnivoro nascosto e mimetizzato. Eh sì, perchè sto verme non si muove ed è dello stesso colore della pianta. se ne sta lì e spera che tu non lo veda e ci passi sopra per poterti mordere e avvelenare.
Il gioco quindi ti invoglia, o meglio costringe, a fare due cose: o sparare come un pazzo in ogni cespuglio (e poi raccogliere i proiettili, che ricordo essere estremamente limitati), o ad andare lento come una lumaca per ispezionare ogni singola pianta.
Prima o poi raggiungerete il secondo livello, e lì troverete altri simpatici nemici, come Kamikaze esplosivi tondeggianti rosa, esattamente come i frutti degli alberi.

3) I PRO
[list]
[*]Non l'ho pagato
[*]La grafica low poly in sè per sè è gradevole, così come i colori neon
[*]Carina l'idea della banca
[/list]
4) I CONS
[list]
[*]I nemici
[*]I nemici
[*]In pratica tutto il resto
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198159337231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1524127240}
review:
Real fun to play most of the time, 
[b]BUT[/b]
[list]
[*]Random level building is absolute sh*t because anything can spawn everywhere and everywhere makes for some impossible situations: 
[list]
    [*]Having more than 4 turrets in a single room with the batteries [i]behind [/i] them so you can't destroy them from up front, alongside other moving enemies 
    [*]Having one of those charging bull-like things spawn around the first corner after reaching a floor, which makes it impossible to pass or even outrun because you can't get past it
    [*]Having those exploding things placed so that they immediately explode after they see you, with no other way around them
[/list]
[*]I get the whole 'limited supplies thing' but having so many different items but no possibility to carry more than 1 (or 2 with a bag) is makes it feel like such a waste everytime you have to leave something behind
[/list]
[b]BUT[/b]
I still recommend this game, since the above problems aren't guaranteed to happen and everything plays so damn [i]smooth [/i]

oh, and the soundtrack is amazing and sound effects really complement the gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198055106830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1483762459}
review:
Probably one of the toughest rogue-like games i have ever played. Haven't gotten that far, it can be frustrating but the upgrades and items are in my opinion, very well designed. The banking and "will" system is pretty awesome as well (possibly unique), making it easier to set yourself up for success. I got this game a long time ago, and i always find myself coming back to it, so it gets more attention then a lot of other games in my library that I never come back too.

It is a simple plot and the art style is pretty sweet, the neon/contrasting scheme allows for the enemies to have more POP. It has most of the themes you will find in any other regular rogue likes such as secret rooms and random purchasable items. Not sure if there are any bosses, i have only come across the very fast/sneaky animal enemies and the turrets. Depending on your preference for gameplay (are you a fast paced go-go-go shooter, or are you a slow stealthy look for secrets) you may find this game frustrating if you are the first. I say that because the enemies move quickly and are sneaky shits, so for me if I am moving too quickly i get stuck in bad situations easily and i also miss key cards or secret rooms. There is a mechanic in the game that may piss some people off, which is the locking of doors behind you that can occur as you progress forward. This prevents you from going back to get items or find secrets etc. Kind of annoying but it forces the player (if they care enough) to move slowly through the environment and inspect everything before moving forward.

Combat feels awesome, you get a gun with 6? bullets and the best thing about your gun is you can pick up your ammo after shooting. Most of the upgrades do NOT apply to your gun, they are for giving you more tools to survive not necessarily for amping up your guns firepower. This game does not appear to be a bullet-hell, so dont expect crazy situations of 15-20 enemies converging on you as you blast a millions lazer jet flying, most crazy situations i have been in were maybe 7-8 enemies in a room and not all had noticed me. Now that might not hold true for later levels, but the upgrades and items dont necessarily lend to a bullet-hell play style. It is definitely more stealth focused in my opinion.

Though it is tough, i always find myself coming back to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061029479', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1645826376}
review: If you're looking for a fun shooter game that you can just pick and play without too much else, then this is your game. There's not a lot of story to it but there's just enough to be interesting and you really just have to rely on your skills to get you through the levels. The whole game is easy to pick up, but that's not to say it's easy. Actually it can get downright brutal. I really enjoy it and anyone who's looking for a simple shooter to test their reflexes will enjoy it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060797100', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1534591087}
review:
Heavy Bullets

People may despise this game, but I love it! Som people think it's th wrong idea, but I totally get it. I like the idea of the reloading system and the way you reuse the bullets. There are a great variety of monsters to defeat as you try and beat eight levels without dying. It is really fun, I'm still attempting to beat it.

Overall, the idea of this game is perfect and overwhelmingly difficult. I would recommend this game to many types of gamers who like difficult games and or FPS games.

8.5/10

review: This game is great fun. A rogue-like, perma-death, procedurally generated, polygonal first-person shooter. You start off with a very limited amount of ammo, shoot monster things that pop up from the ground, pick your bullets back up and reuse them. It's a clever concept and is a blast if you get it on sale. 8/10 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986325765', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2525, 'last_played': 1528998441}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a rogue-lite FPS with pretty high difficulty. Like most Rougue-ish games you only get one life (although you can inherit goodies from your last go-though) and of course the levels are randomly generated. There is a pretty good selection of goodies to pick up and use such as knives, bombs, speed pills, sniper shots and more and not all of them are good for you. There is SOME character  development as you can also be upgraded with more hit-points, the ability to carry (oh boy!) 2 items!  (by default you can only carry one item at a time), increased pickup range and more. I really enjoy the banking system that allows you to store away money and items for your next playthough, or trade unused items for cash. It's just a small thing, but really helps flesh out Heavy Bullets into a more deep experience.  Play-wise it is a pretty sparse corridor shooter that focuses on short skirmishes with a small amount of enemies at a time. A couple small mistakes will generally lead to your demise as pretty much any of your foes will kill you easily given the chance. Oh, and watch out for the grass: they just love to hide in the freakin' grass. I warned You. The presentation is pretty simple: Atari 2600-meets-3d Playstation One graphics, with sound consisting of bleeps and bloops reminiscent of the 8 bit era.  It's a unique look and I like it quite a bit although I realize it may not be to eveyone's tastes. 
All and all I like Heavy Bullets: It's great to play in small bursts and has just enough depth to keep me coming back for more. Good stuff indeed. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wmzx_Werjr4

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1469087943}
review:
In typical rogue like fashion, nothing in this game is explained. You need to go online to figure out all the different things. That would be ok if the game were worth playing multiple times, because you guessed it, if you die you lose all your progress. What's worse is you dont start with bought upgrades, money, items, extra bullets, etc, which always makes it more enjoyable. Nope you can either put your money in your bank before you die, as if you know when thats going to happen, or you can put some money down to get a much smaller percentage of it if you restart. Also there's only 1 gun, and its a pistol. Also, if collecting coins isn't tedious enough, you also have to collect your bullets every time, and just like coins, standing almost on top of them doesn't even work unless you have bought collector upgrade, making it extra annoying. There's tons of cheap damage. You open door get immediately hurt. There's turrets that shoot every 1 second but you have to aim at this small bos with your TINY crosshairs so you often get hurt with more than 1. Enemies are much faster than you, meaning you can't run backwards if they're chasing you and kite them. Some cheap enemies like bombs that are right around the corner and you can't do anything before they are on your and explode if killed and hurt you. There's snakes that blend into grass and are impossible to see if not looking for, but there's grass everywhere, so you can get hurt by not always looking for them 100% of the time. Then there are cheap deaths like me fighting a boss, then I throw a bomb at it, it blows up immediately right in my face killing me instantly and I lost 30-45 min of progress for some inexplicable reason.....no want to try again. This is also because you fight the same 3 enemies in the exact same corridors with the exact same 1 gun the entire game. Then there's terrible design decisions like the fact you can only carry 1 single item at a time, and increased health, or backpack to carry 1 more item are super expensive or super rare to find, causing you to never get much stronger or change over the course of the level. So with repetitive play, lack of character strength and progression during play, and no carrying over to next life there's no incentive for this game.

Could have been much better. 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091126198', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1496873827}

Don't get me wrong I enjoy it and the art style isn't bad but some decisions with the visual design (screen flashing red on low health, neon colors for text making it sorta hard to read) reaaaaally could use a little work. author: {'steamid': '76561198041017157', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1565914084}
review:
I do like how it sports a cool art style, might be the sole reason I got intrigued, and it has somewhat fun, simple mechanics, but I get really annoyed whenever I try to head to the security mainframe.

The gameplay, as I said, is easy to pick up and play, and it was fun trying to conquer a room filled with turrets, while looking out for snakes in the grass, but after the initial shock and X runs, and despite being randomly generated, the game gets somewhat dull and repetitive.  Said repetitiveness must be plaguing roguelikes in general, so it isn't totally at fault, but at least for the first half, I just had to counter very simple AIs for quite a long time, in environments that only differ as to where the doors and vending machines are now set at.  I believe a simple game can still have a lot of depth, but this isn't it.

Another bad thing, the game stutters quite a few times, for 1/4 of a second, and whenever it happens, it's always right after I killed an enemy, oddly enough.  I'm well aware I sound like the "Dur, it's only 720p and 30fps" crowd, but when I have to kill 2 enemies that are aiming at me, thinking I could quickshot the both of them, the game freezes, stuttering me and messing up my sight on things, even for the briefest of moments, and the other enemy then is right up my grill without warning, it's pretty lame and it happened more times than I would be comfortable with, heck it happened during the first boss, leaving me as a very salty barnacle.

Lastly, if I have a Last Will, which SHOULD save my items upon death, and is in the backpack when I die, it becomes useless and I lose my 15+ keycards and bullets.  I'm perfectly fine with passive items not working in the backpack, but I think that this is just nitpicking right here.

I'm not having a great time with this.  There is some fun to be had at times, but if you are like me and only got intrigued by the visuals in the first place, you may end up disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079840846', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1469539181}
review:
This game is like the Super Meat Boy of First Person Shooters. It's super challenging but yet not to the point where you just want to give up. The fact that the game is 1 life, die, game over...Makes it really fun. You have to treat every turn around the corner, every opening of a door, like its life or death..cause it is. The style and artwork of the game is top-notch if you're into retro/hotline miami type graphics. And the music is just enough to get your heart pumping when needed. Overall, for a price of $9.99...You can''t go wrong with this title. I'd give it a 10/10 for its price point.

Pros:
+Great gameplay/controls
+Interesting environments/enemies
+1 life and it's game over

Cons:
-None

Buy it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980803506', 'num_games_owned': 1473, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1501146033}
review:
Purple snakes in purple bushes

Other than that, the game was pretty fun, but I was able to complete a full run on it on my second run ever, definitely one of the lightest "rouge-lites" I've played, but still pretty fun. You'll probably get more time out of it if you go for all the achievements but outside of that you don't get much out of a completed run it seems (like extra content and such).

I think it's a good game but if you're on the fence I would say wait for a sale since it can be extremely short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4, 'last_played': 1466964345}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Heavy Bullets is another game from the fantastic beautiful people at Devolver Digital. Heavy Bullets is a rogue like shooter and that's... basically it. You go through levels upon levels, randomly generated by the way, shooting enemies, collecting coins and trying not to die

The game doesn't have anything special but has an interesting art style and good music, but overall, it's just another generic rogue like shooter. If you like rogue like games, then give Heavy Bullets a go!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994922794', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1527388936}
review:
Ultra saturated. Ultra challenging. Ultra whacky.

Despite the simplicity of this shooter it has a lot of depth to it and rewards tenacity and forward planning while using the rogue-like school of procedurally generated levels.  Rooms become familiar, but you never know what's ahead or if you'll get another chance to buy the item in the store before you need it.

Definitely recommended if you dig the aesthetic and like to learn how to master a game by playing it and experimenting for yourself with what works and what doesn't.

review:
Fun game but frustrating.
The whole game lags about 5% of the time when you fire, and it either wont fire the bullet, or the massive frame drop will cause you to get hit. With firing your gun being the main game mechanic, it is completly unacceptable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981437309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1626026184}
review: Un petit Rogue-Like permadeath très sympa ! Univers, ambiance et histoire atypique et légèrement dérangé de la part de Devolver comme on a pu le découvrir avec Hotline Miami, un jeu qui repose sur le skill et les choix que vous allez faire un peu à la manière de Tower Of Guns auquel il ressemble beaucoup (du simple fait que vous montez un a un les étages d'un "donjon" pour vider la tour de ses monstres). C'est un jeu passe temps sans prétention, qui vaut largement son billet pour son travail bien fini ! Tout y est ! Rien à redire sur le jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198117530781', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1611105347}
review:
This is one of the most fun thrilling games that you can just pick up and have a good time with. Heavy Bullets is a first person rouge like shooter that is certainly worth the time and money to play. I got it during the devolver sale and I love it! If you want to see my reaction first hand check out my Shall We Play (let's play)( https://youtu.be/7hKCcNtptOk ) on my youtube channel: IomiereGaming ... You'll get a good idea of what the game is like and also hopefully be entertainedin the process. But really such a good game especially if you just want something you can pick up and enjoy whenever. I love the sort of classic feel to it even though its a very modern game as well. It just feels good to play.

P.S. I reccomend using the knife if you can find one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018699344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1458988729}
review:
This game is pretty fun but I'd only recommend buying it durring a sale like I did. I don't think it's worth 10 bucks but thats subject to each person's opinion. It has some replay value and even if it doesn't particularly grab me I find myself loading it up every so often. 

Pros:
It's got some pretty interesting mechanics what with the bullets being reusable and causing you to retrieve them due to the fact that you have nothing to defend yourself if you run out of bullets. The whole rougelike mechanics are pretty heavy in this game as well. You don't really make a lot of money off of enemies so with the prices going up the deeper you go it becomes really important to balance what you want to spend your money on. Potions, healing, bombs, the discount (which should be top priority), your life insurance, etc. With money being so important it both makes sense and sucks that almost everything in the game only sells for 5 dollars, with a few exceptions. 

Cons:
Although it can be fun I can't really recommend it to people, as interesting and unique as it is. As many have said there is an unsolved sutter issue that happens every so often. Its pretty random when it happens. You can go a whole game without it and sometimes you cant get it to stop. On top of that I feel like theres some balance issues with hitboxes and such. I've been attacked through a wall from around the corner by one of the imps as well as a crawler. Turret placement can be a real pain to deal with when its only weakpoint is behind it and it shoots two times per second. The turrets are deadly accurate as well, forcing you to constantly move in order to dodge them which can really put you at a disadvantage if theres more than one or other enemies in the same room. I've also had it on more than one occasion where a turret's bullet clipped a corner and still damaged me even though I was out of the line of fire/line of sight. 

On top of all that the developer has given up on the game so there won't be any updates in the future. It's a pretty barebones game that has the potential to be better but sadly wont be. I wouldn't mind seeing some more balances, bug fixes, and additonal items and enemies. 

I personally wouldn't give it more than 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013676721', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1458831117}
review:
Every decision matters in Heavy Bulllets, which is strange for a game with a 2-sentence story and maybe as much dialogue.  This game could be called a management sim: You're always keeping track of money, items, and the titular bullets, which you need to pick up after firing. At least then I wouldn't be making purists angry by calling it a roguelike.

Heavy Bullets is a hard game, but you won't know that until you've already gotten through one or two levels. It has a really nice learning curve that punishes mistakes just hard enough for you to not make them again in 5 minutes. You may be frustrated, but there are almost no moments in the game where you can call bullshit. 

I may be the odd one out on this, but I feel like the music takes away from the game. It plays at intervals, and then only for a short period of time. The music is good, sure. But the atmosphere I get when it's not playing feels a lot more tense. Pick up this game if you want dungeon crawling with a gun. And you don't mind the vaporwave color pallete they use (which I love)

author: {'steamid': '76561197966495319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1706780402}
review: Heavy Bullets is a great game. It plays perfect for me and has awesome replay value. I love the level design and the the sound effects. Everything is simple yet effective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001025709', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1458849366}
review:
**Edit: After some progress, I have to say that unfortunately, the stutter 'lag' massively increases in the last few levels. I would still recommend this game, because the first 4 levels were fine for me and gave me a lot of enjoyment, but you might want to wait for a sale. The lag on the last few stages makes it hard to enjoy, especially for a game that is heavily reliant on fast reactions and twitch shooting. However, I would say that the first 4-5 stages are a lot of fun, and I would say it is still probably worth buying if you get the game on sale.**

If you enjoy twitch shooters, difficult indie games, roguelikes or dungeon crawlers, I can't recommend Heavy Bullets more.

I have not experienced any of the extreme lag others have said, but I do get the occasional stutter (maybe once or twice a floor) but that generally doesn't happen in combat and barely effects gameplay. **Edit: In the last few stages it rapidly increases makes the game almost unplayable. Be warned**

Even if lag might be an issue, it's well worth buying it. You can see if you experience the lag and if you do you can easily refund it.

Now, to the game:

The gameplay is addictive and fun. For games like this, a lot of the time I find myself getting bored and just being careless/running through quickly (looking at BOI). With this game, I find myself much more invested in each playthough, 

There is a sense of progression - upgrades make a noticable effect and the further you get, the harder the enemies get, but also the more equipped you are to deal with them. There are 8 stages (it shows you every time you load the next stage) and I have only got to 4 so far, but I already feel determined to beat the game. It might take a while though.

There isn't much to learn in terms of items and enemies (again, not like BOI), so you generally don't feel cheated after you get used to the pacing of the game (and learn about the three main types of enemies - charging enemies, worms and turrets). None of the items you pick up can effect you negatively and most are pretty descriptive as to what they are, so you are never left thinking 'What does this item do?'

The randomly generated aspect of the game can be annoying at times (I'm assuming that is what causes the occasional stuttering?) with some places being out of reach, but it also gives the game insane replayability.

The biggest gripe I have with this game is the explosives. You start with three grenades, but you only do a tiny throw when you use them. This makes them basically useless. There are several explosive items in the game and I barely find myself using them. There is an item that lets you throw them further but it is fairly rare and when I find it I am normally carrying more useful items anyway.

In summary, if you are interested in this game and think you might like it, get it. I don't know about full price but it is definitely worth it on sale. If it tags too much, get a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038087671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1637385011}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053065726', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1482342696}
review:
Era pra ser um jogo muito bom, mas tem um bug de stutter (como se o jogo estivesse lagando o tempo todo) bastante conhecido e que não tem solução.
Com esse bug é impossível jogar.
Você pode até se arriscar comprando o jogo, jogar e ver se o bug aparece ou não.
Se não aparecer, otimo!
Se aparecer, peça para steam devolver seu dinheiro (refund).

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Could be a great game, but it has a very well know stutter bug without a fix.
The bug makes the game unplayable.
You could take the risk of buying it, play it and check if you get the stutter or not. 
If not, great!
If you do, just ask for the refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970833221', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1469990538}
review:
If you like random-gen FPS rogue-likes, you'll probably like this.

-Movement is smooth and streamlined. No jumping or sprinting makes me think of clasic DOOM.
-Items and Item management is interesting without being overly complex.
-Maps tend to be very simple. Built more for speed runs than exploration. 
-Life insurance and banks allow you to save resources for latter play throughs.

The game isn't breaking any new ground here, but the gameplay is satisfying and the graphics style works well. I found myself enjoying each playthrough and getting more in the zone each time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047455579', 'num_games_owned': 2682, 'num_reviews': 1289, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1455232151}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057260968', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1491436531}
review:
¿Alguna ves te a dado un infarto porque has pisado una serpiente?

Bueno, esto es 10 vez peor.



Chistes aparte, que es Heavy Bullets?

Es un Roguelike/Dungeon Crawler/FPS, para dar una remota idea, un The Binding Of Isaac mas psicodeligo con un revolver en lugar de lagrimas y en primera persona.

La historia del juego es la siguiente, estas en una especie de sala recreativa, en que los usuarios pueden entrar tranquilamente a matar criaturas de forma segura, sin embargo algo sale mal y las criaturas empiezan a herir a los usuarios, ¿Cual es la solucion de la compañia? Enviar a centenares de conserjes con la esperanza de que alguno llegue al nucleo y resetee el sistema, ¿realista verdad?

El juego en si es muy desafiante, todo se basa en tu unica arma, un revolver que mata a cualquier cosa de 1 tiro, sin embargo el revolver usa una municion muy grande (Heavy Bullets, balas pesadas) que pueden volverse a usar, osea, nunca esta la posibilidad de quedarse sin municion -a menos que dispares a la desesperada a algun bicho y salgas corriendo sin municion- pero para poder seguir disparando tendras que volver a recoger las balas.

El sistema de mejora del juego se basa en tiendas, en ellas compras mejoras permanentes, objetos pasivos y activos y seguros de vida......¿seguros de vida? sip, seguros de vida, ten algo seguro en este juego, vas a morir, y vas a perder todo a menos que guardes tu dinero en el banco o tengas un seguro de vida, el cual te guardara cierto porcentaje de tu dinero al momento de tu muerte.

Los enemigos, no son muchos, pero tampoco pocos, y uno solo no es un problema -excepto los jefes y la,,,,,cosa con forma de chicle,,,,explosiva- pero son numerosos, en salas grandes, son desafiantes, Imps corriendo a por ti a toda velocidad, moscas gigantes volando a morderte, una mezcla de imps y arañas que pueden bloquear tus ataques, torretas disparandote, y mis odiados favoritos, los gusano-serpientes, esos hijos de p*** que le dan ese toque de suspenso y terror al juego.

¿Lo recomiendo? Totalmente, mas si te encantan los juegos Rogue-Like, es un poco corto, pero es muy entretenido

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072656995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1455002003}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198011775329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1568659151}
review:
Le principe est plutôt fun, on pense immédiatement à Eldritch aussi bien pour le minimalisme que pour les mécaniques de jeu. Si on rigole en abattant les premiers monstres, la gestion des balles devient vite un véritable casse tête face aux tourelles pour peu que leur hitbox soit difficile d'accès.
Les bugs entâchent l'expérience, j'ai des micro saccades régulières sur ma config (I5 & GT 640m) alors que le jeu est franchement light visuellement. De plus la gestion des impacts est parfois douteuse au niveau des tourelles avec des lasers qui traversent les murs... Horriblement frustrant quand on fait déjà tant d'efforts pour préserver le moindre coeur. 
Le manque de finition gâche vraiment le plaisir à moyen terme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050472614', 'num_games_owned': 1285, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1603346107}
review:
[h1] ОБЗОР Linux / SteamOS версии игры [/h1]

Хороший процедурно генерируемый шутер от первого лица, с необычной графической составляющей.
В этой игре умирать нам придётся часто, с жадностью собирать монетки с убитых нами противников и тратить на апргрейды (скорость перезарядки, скорость бега и т.д) ну и конечно же пройти 8 уровней, которые даются ой как не легко. Звуковая часть игры тоже не плоха, прислушиваешься к звукам за стенкой и пытаешься определить тип врага. 

НО! Все эти приятности меркнут по сравнению с тем что у игры есть ОГРОМНЫЙ БАГ, это ПЕРИОДИЧЕСКИЕ ФРИЗЫ, которые очень часто мешают играть (СТРЕЛЯЕШЬ В ТУРЕЛЬ И БАХ ИГРА НА СЕКУНДУ ПОДВИСЛА, В ИТОГЕ МЫ ИМЕЕМ ПОТЕРЯННУЮ ЖИЗНЬ, ТАК КАК ТУРЕЛЬ В НАС ПОПАЛА). 
Игру покупать не советую, разработчик забил на проект и исправлять баг не будет и это очень обидно у игры есть потенциал, но увы...

review: As enjoyable as the gameplay is, I can't recommend it. Many people (even with powerful rigs) have huge stuttering issues that get progressively worse as the levels go by. The final bossfight becomes impossible because of them, since at that point of the game the stuttering evolves to at least a second long freezes every 3-4 seconds. For a rogue-lite that punishes death pretty heavily, that's a pretty big issue, yet the developer has abandoned trying to fix it.
