author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2433, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1445557137}
review:
[b]In a heavily flooded roguelite FPS market, [i]Heavy Bullets[/i] fails to rise above to anything memorable.[/b] Is it terribly bad? No. Would I tell all my friends to run out and buy it? [b]Absolutely not.[/b]

Every FPS roguelite has a gimmick or some novel mechanic. In this case, I would say its having limited ammo and having the ability to pick up/retrieve your bullets. The artwork is also fairly interesting, but then again thats true for most of this titles competitors:

[i]Tower of Guns[/i], [i]Ziggurat[/i], [i]Eldritch[/i], [i]Paranautical Activity[/i], and [i]Reciever[/i], just to name a few. The list goes on and on, right? [b]If you want to compete in a flooded market, you MUST really bring something special to the table.[/b] As I said before, [i]Heavy Bullets[/i] is not bad per-se, but why do I need another one of these titles?

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Artwork is interesting enough
+Controls work fine
+Its cheap

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Not nearly addicting enough for me to keep playing
-Everything is too standard, down to the vending machine 'shops'. I know this is a roguelite and we need those elements, but I am asking developers to start thinking outside the box more. Its no longer enough to add one or two different mechanics to these indie titles.
-I hear theres not much content as far as game length, but I didn't finish it.

[b]Get it in a bundle or on the cheap, but otherwise I'd check out any number of other alternative roguelite games - I've reviewed several of the ones I listed above.[/b] 

Peace,

author: {'steamid': '76561198025072099', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1450134561}
review:
If it works fine for you, Heavy Bullets is a great roguelike FPS.
If you are getting random lag\freezing, I'd recommend to not play the game (wait until a fix is released and\or refund for time being) to spare yourself lots of frustration. This is not a game that can skip a couple of frames without getting the player killed.

Update: Well that never got fixed. Thanks, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089943640', 'num_games_owned': 1438, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1449468123}
review:
This game is quite fun and challenging. If you like FPS games and dungeon crawlers, then you'll like this.

It will take a bit of time to get a hang of this game. First, you are limited on bullets that you can pick up when shot. Think of them as nerf darts. Life is precious too, as any life you lose will mean a lot to you in the long run. Some enemy placements and weaknesses will need to be learned but won't take long.

The randomization of the game levels keep the game addictive and fun. It never stops surprising you and you never know what upgrade or item you'll get, which is one of my favorite parts of the game.

Visually it is nice. It has a blend of bright colors on polygonal models which are pleasing to the eye. Sound is nice too, gives the perfect impression of the world around you.

The game is worth $10 if you feel you can be hooked for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082499576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1697475692}
review: This game runs on my potato laptop. It is beautiful and simple. The gun has pin point accuracy and so shooting the enemies sometimes feels like threading a needle. It is a really satisfying game albeit an incredibly unforgiving one should you die without insurance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031525163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1666303389}
review:
Heavy Bullets no es un juego complicado, y es un infierno de juego.
Dejad que me explique.

Haciendo de la simplicidad conceptual su bandera, Heavy Bullets se presenta como un Shooter Rogue Like en el que deberemos avanzar por unos niveles minimalistas en color y detalle, pero no por ello ausentes de peligros y desafíos. Monstruos y máquinas de todo tipo se interponen en nuestro camino, y no dudarán ni un segundo en acabar con nosotros. ¿Qué herramientas disponemos los jugadores para defendernos de tales peligros? Una sola arma, un revolver. Y seis balas. Seis balas pesadas.

Y aqui radica el principal punto fuerte y punto débil del juego simultáneamente, porque cada vez que disparemos una de nuestras preciadas municiones, podremos recogerla y volver a utilizarla, tantas veces como sea necesario. Una idea original y muy divertida, un concepto simple y genial pero con doble filo:

- Por una parte es muy desafiante tener que ser preciso siempre, puesto que no podemos malgastar nuestras escasas balas, ya que a veces ir a recogerlas no es una opción hasta que la sala no sea segura. 

- Por  la otra este revolver es el único arma del juego, y aunque en dosis pequeñas no se nota demasiado, jugando durante horas puede resultarnos insuficiente. 

Existen una miríada de Power Ups y objetos que modifican, y bastante la experiencia de juego (la piedra maldita es uno de mis favoritos, convirtiendo nuestro fiel revolver en una suerte de lanza balas explosivas), pero solo parchean las evidentes limitaciones jugables del concepto. 
La variedad de enemigos es muy aceptable, y hacen un uso muy inteligente de la escasa paleta cromática del juego para jugar al camuflaje y a las emboscadas. Mantener el oido agudo te salvará la vida en más de una ocasión. Dicho esto, la música prácticamente brilla por su ausencia. No se la echa demasiado de menos, pero es escasa y hay que decirlo.

No me malinterpretéis, el juego es muy divertido y la mecánica de "reciclar" la munición es genial y muy refrescante, pero tener un solo arma disponible reduce y bastante las horas de juego que se pueden disfrutar seguidas. Yo personalmente pagaría por un DLC con una escopeta de dos cañones, por ejemplo. 
¿Recomendaría entonces este juego? Sin duda, pero con matices. Si te gusta el género Rogue Like, los shooters un poco diferentes y te atrae el apartado gráfico, adelante. Aún así lo recomiendo en dosis pequeñas: Jugar, avanzar, matar y morir. Morir mucho, porque Heavy Bullets es condenadamente difícil, como buen Rogue Like, y te hará volver a intentarlo una y otra vez. 
Con solo seis balas y un gastado revolver.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999706674', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1446938557}
review: Heavy Bullet to mała, aczkolwiek ciekawa gra studia Devolver Digital. Jej cena jest dość niska, ja sam nabyłem ją za około 1$. Produkcja ta jest synergią dwóch gatunków, dungeona i fpsa. Gra składa się z 8 etapów, mało? warto wspomnieć, że nie posiada ona systemu zapisu, więc przejście jej troche czasu zajmuje. Na naszej drodze napotkamy kilka rodzajów przeciwników. Są to zarówno zwykłe potwory jak i wieżyczki, strzelające w nas pociskami bądź granatami. Co jakiś czas zostaniemy zmuszeni do walki z bossem, która w cale nie jest taka łatwa. W Heavy bullets występuje tylko jedna broń, jednak jest możliwość posiadania jednego, lub kilku przedmiotów, które dają nam ciekawe bonusy, bądź podwyższają nasze statystyki. Oprawa audiowizualna, jak na cene i rozmiar gry jest całkiem przyzwoita. Poziom trudności jest naprawde wysoki, tak więc nie będziecie się nudzić :). Podsumowując Heavy Bullets to ciekawa mini-gierka, która jest w pełni warta swojej ceny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993937185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1531151279}
review:
プレイヤーはウイルスに侵されたメインフレームの再起動を依頼されてシステムにダイブした凄腕ハッカーとなり、暴走した防衛システムやウイルスを破壊しながら、最深部であるlevel8への到達を目指す、というSFシューティング・ローグライクFPSという感じのゲーム。

毎回、多岐に渡る種類のアイテム、そしてダンジョンがランダムに生成され、リプレイアビリティは高く、短い時間で何度も挑戦できる。
このゲームのユニークな点として挙げられるのが、武器であるリボルバーの弾を拾って再利用する点だ。
一度発射された弾は敵であれ壁であれ当たると上に弾き飛ばされ、これを拾ってはリロードを繰り返す。
つまりこのゲームは無限で撃ちまくる前提でも無ければ、弾切れの憂き目にも合わないが、手持ちの弾の管理が重要となってくる、といったバランスである。

ステージの随所には楽しそうなBGMを奏でる各種自動販売機が設置してあり、敵を倒して得たお金で様々なサービスを利用できるのも面白い。
ATM機では死亡時の所持金現象ペナルティを軽減させるRPGおなじみのシステムがあり、様々なアイテムの中にはなんと遺書まで売っていたり、
ヘルス関係を扱う販売機や、予備弾販売機なんかもあり、買うと実物がゴロッと出口から転がってくる。かわいい。
ただし、販売機は弾の飛び交う射線上にあると大変なことになるので注意。
買ったり拾ったりしたアイテムの効果はESCを押したメニュー画面で確認できる。

移動も照準も動きは素早く、その中での精密射撃を要求されるので、FPSに慣れた人向けのゲームである。
また、ゲームは現状で日本語非対応であるが、英語はアイテムの説明くらいにしか出てこない上、とても簡単なので心配は全くいらない。

言うなれば、DOOM時代のドアを開ける緊張感を知っている人なんかには、特にオススメかもしれない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198021793130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1447123726}
review:
Aqui um review em vídeo:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HiwBEv3-bsk

E aqui em texto: 

FPS solitário e estiloso com mapas procedurais onde o objetivo é arrumar resetar um computador defeituoso, responsável pelos inimigos. São 8 fases e sua arma tem só 6 slots de balas, que são recicláveis. Atirou, tem que ir buscar a bala ou você fica sem munição.  Pelo caminho vários upgrades, itens médicos e armas para você achar ou comprar nas lojinhas. Para comprar os itens você tem à disposição caixas eletrônicos para sacar ou depositar grana. Depois que você morre, você pode começar o jogo do zero mas grana no banco. Com essa mecânica é fácil chegar ao final. Difícil é bater os dois chefões do jogo. 

Algumas dicas:

- Junte pelo menos 600 moedas para fazer uma tentativa séria
- Compre vida, o máximo que conseguir
- Balas, muitas balas
- Speed pills!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077052451', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1587905053}
review:
From all other game titles on Steam, Heavy Bullets offers the tremendous Fast-Paced Ferst-Person-Shooting expirience.

In this game:
"Every mistake is punished!"

Make every bullet count!
Act Quickly!
Plan your moves!
Otherwise you might get yourself killed in the blink of an eye.

The game's endless replayability makes things more intresting. Once you've finished the game (Either by dying or succeeding) you're on for the whole new action.

Only Cons in this game is various of bugs that can be found troughout the game...

The most addicting FPS game ever played in my entire life!
Would recommend it to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991569676', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2593, 'last_played': 1451453191}
review:
Surprised that given the Rogue-Lite craze in indie games this title isn't more talked about, especially after being played and promoted by many popular individuals.

Is a low poly FPS with an abstract but appealing visual style, the neon colors have a good contrast so they never feel like an eyesore, and the style has a neat early 3D vibe, the sound design having a glitchy vibe to it.

The gameplay reminds me of the original Wolfestein 3D; there’s no jumping, you walk through semi Labyrinthic corridors killing enemies and finding secrets, but that’s where the similarities end. The random generation is really good; I never encountered myself stuck or in unfair situations that can’t be solved by your own skill. It has some heart pounding moments which makes this game memorable at times, but going through random adversity never gets old.

It has an interesting item variety, which can help you or ruin you over. However, while some items make for different and interesting play styles, I wish the game had more to offer.  Many of the items are only there to be used for the achievements or feel arbitrary, meaning you’ll be selling those or ignoring them altogether. An update that expands the item pool would be greatly appreciated, but I also appreciate that the game is mostly skill focused and you don’t need to rely on the items in order to make it to the end, but they help.

Don’t expect a deep plot or story in this tittle, it constantly contradicts itself (In purpose) and anything regarding the ‘plot’ is told via flavor text and some small things within the game. Its main focus its gameplay with very minor plot elements.

Overall, the execution is original and really fun. The idea of having to recollect your bullets in this manner is something I’ve never seen before, and it’s well executed. Being able to play the game at your own pace is a great addition too. Go slow or go fast, is a blast.

[h1]Warning![/h1]
There are people suffering with stuttering while playing, there are many theories for this issue and you can read up more about it on the forums. I play this game on a very out dated toaster and barely noticed issues regarding this, for me it’s rare to say the least. But the stuttering can prove unforgiving or to ruin the game entirely given its nature, if you suffer from it and can’t find a way to fix it, a refund is recommendable. As much as I enjoy this game, no one should go through that, and the creator should make a better effort to fix this problem.

review:
Well then. I started this game up thinking I was going to beat it faster than whoever I had seen playing it.
No spoils, I wasn't halfway done with the game yet before I realised I was not gonna beat it fast. I'm not done yet, I got to playing about 87% of the game so far. but it's just really fun and really well done. (I'm saying fun even though sometimes it makes me shout at my computer and tear my limbs off)

I'm rating this game 10/10 for it's genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061198415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1700518821}
review:
Picked this one up on a whim after a brief mention on Stop Skeletons From Fighting's review of Cave Noire (Thanks, Derek!)

First-person shooting roguelike with a trippy presentation and VERY limited ammo. You're stuck with a simple revolver, but you can't get too trigger-happy. Bullets are incredibly scarce, though you can pick them up after firing. The enemies are ruthless and will destroy you if you don't tread carefully. Sometimes they even blend in with the pastel-colored scenery (GOD DAMN SNAKES). There's plenty of items and upgrades that completely change the dynamic of the game. And, much like any good roguelike, one more run is just never enough.

review: Very fun arcade style game. It's like taking Battlefield games, morphing it with PacMan and Zelda, then making it good, unlike one of the games I listed... (I'll give you a hint, it isn't PacMan or Zelda) The more you play the more you find out, it is a lot more in depth then it seems. This game offers a lot more strategy then just, "Shoot fast" and with the vending machines there is so much to do. If you were on edge about it, just buy it. It is a really fun game with a lot more then it looks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025330870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1461455273}
review:
This game feels like it could be good. It had potential. Ruined by a bug. It constantly hitches every few seconds. With the pace of this game it leads to death. Many people have had this issue and continue to have this issue.  Not recommended until it is fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001916427', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1449690103}
review:
用外星人的优惠券加上现在的折扣，人民币2块钱即可入手。
200M不到的独立FPS，有roughlike成分，非常值得一玩。
子弹稀少，六发重型左轮，可以一枪解决大部分敌人，子弹还可以（必须）回收，因为你一共只有6颗，多的只能花钱买，所以要及时回收子弹并装填。游戏画面比较抽象，有一些敌人不容易发现，前进的时候不能太冒失，生命还是比较脆弱的，失血容易回血难（钱）。有意思的是你在游戏里面赚的钱可以存到银行里面，这样就算挂了，重新游戏后还可以取出来，省了不少事。有一些特定功能的道具，起主动或被动效果，没有深入了解有些道具作用不明，身上一次只能带一个，感觉有点像以撒的味道。

游戏虽然看起来简陋，但是玩起来的紧张感丝毫不弱，遇到激烈战况忘记装子弹然后无力反抗...后退过程中被看不见的敌人打死，然后发现居然是一只躲在草丛里的小虫...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043679458', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1447379268}
review:
Really enjoyable FPS roguelite (not fully rogue due to banking system, but otherwise is). Good trigger finger reaction time recommended for certain encounters! Teaches financial planning and resource management as biproducts while playing. Should appeal to the speed-running community as well.

I advise rebinding either the steam overlay hotkeys or the in-game hotkey for bombs, as you will bomb yourself while going into overlay mode if you don't.

The only real negative I have run into is the game's tendency to drop frames at critical moments of combat. Normally runs  at 180+ fps when frame rate limit is removed.

EDIT: After browsing forum topics, it seems the game may have been abandoned, so the fps stutter issue may never be fixed. Buy with caution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025093178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1646493740}
review:
I was intrigued but a bit iffy with the game, so I bought it at a huge discount. I must say, I got more than my money's worth and the full price should be right on the money with this one.

Not much to say about the game that wasn't already on the store page. It's intense, colourful, playful and fun. You'll need decent reaction times and a good aim to deal with the enemies, as well as a keen eye to spot the kinds that like to hide in the environment. Levels are randomly combines, though you'll probably recognize some of the rooms from your previous playthroughs (this happened to me once in 70 minutes of gameplay). Ammo collection mechanic makes every encounter meaningful, the items you can get offer different approaches to a variety of situations and the banking system allows you to have your more casual playthroughs contribute as increased resources for the playthrough you try to beat the game on.

One complaint is the cheap death I got in the first boss fight: I had no idea what I might be facing, and there was very little time to react once the door opened. This is pretty standard in the genre though, and my first encounter did give me enough info to know what to do the next time, so that's not so big of a deal.

If the game looks fun, buy and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973389214', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1447174182}
review:
It took me a few runs through Heavy Bullets to understand what it wanted out of me. Those few runs were very, very short, brutal and frustrating, until I understood that this roguelike FPS had a depth to it that belied it's simplistic polygonal graphics and LSD-inspired color palette. 

It took me those first few runs to realize that sprinting in guns blazing is not an approach that pays off here. Instead, you creep forward, peeking around corners to catch a glimpse of an enemy turret's weak spot, or one of those dastardly worms hiding almost in plain sight in the undergrowth. 

You hear the bark of an imp that you know is coming screaming towards you at speed, but you haven't got a bead on which direction it's coming from yet. You spin, spot the imp that's right on top of you and squeeze off a single round, all in the blink of an eye. You know that there's a medbay a little ways back, but you also know that you're going to have to press onward to find the money to buy the heal you so desperately need.

Heavy Bullets is *tense*, and it rewards your patience, care and attention to detail. It puts finely calibrated constraints on  every aspect of the game, from your limited titular bullets (a mere six rounds) that you can pick back up off the ground where they fall, to the single-item inventory that has you wondering whether you should have left that armor pickup and taken the megabomb instead. The powerups available for purchase are similarly well balanced, with you never quite sure that you made the right choice. Should you have bought the life insurance that will carry forward some of your money into your next run, or gone hell-for-leather and stocked up on a bigger inventory and a pocketful of rockets?

author: {'steamid': '76561198079730701', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1691185212}
review: This game, is a wonderful game. It's a great and enjoyable experience, hence you playing it carefully. You cannot just rush through and expect to always survive, every enemy in this game is intelligent and is relentless in their goals of killing you. But it's wonderful. Now even though this game is lacking in story, it's brilliantly designed. Playing through this game teaches you slowly the rules of this world through failure and constant repeats. Maybe you're walking through the factory and you have a half a heart left and you die by a snake. What you learn from that is their are snakes that are lurking in bushes and you have to watch out for them. Or maybe you're feeling a bit like hercules and you got a wave of being super cocky only to get blasted by a turret, but it has a green box which kills it when shot. What does that teach you? That certain enemies have sweet spots. See the great thing about this game is every aspect of it's design and the way it's carefully constructed aims to bring about a tense experience which leaves you always at the edge knowing death can be lurking right around the corner. Also it's similar to the binding of issac as their are certain items you can get by purchasing them from vending machines. Would I recommend it? Yes, absolutely. Is it for the care free gamer? Nope, not at all, play a platformer for that. Is it worth the money? Yep. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028719903', 'num_games_owned': 7614, 'num_reviews': 286, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1630111141}
review:
[h1]Ковбои в стерео 3D[/h1]

Heavy Bullets привлекла меня довольно давно.
И в основе завлекаловки - визуальный ряд. Такие цвета в играх встречать не приходилось, по крайней мере как основные.

Но разрабы пошли ещё дальше, это замечательное творение, которое впитало сразу ряд разных жанров.

[h1]Под какие категории попадает игра:[/h1]
[list][*] FPS элемент, вы и ваш револьвер
[*] Rouge-Like, где вы бродите по процедурным лабиринтам
[*] RPG, где вы собираете вещи, собираете деньги, покупаете, продаёте, прокачиваете способности на выбор
[*] Horror. не стоит пропускать нюанс, что местная фауна и антураж заставят вас ни раз дернуться[/list]
[h1]Жирные плюсы:[/h1]
[list][*] Общая идея "ковбоя"! Это просто шикарно, когда вы - стрелок с несменяемым револьвером, и каждая выпущенная пуля может быть подобрана снова. Вы можете щелкать как опешивший от страха, спустив весь барабан, а потом быть разорванным на части. Одна из игр, где промахи игра особо не прощает. Нужно стараться держать хладнокровие и стрелять первым, амиго!
[*] Вещи довольно интересные. Местами они бесполезны, но это слишком субъективное заявление. Уверен, что найдутся те игроки, которые предпочтут поставить несколько ловушек, чем рисковать и предоставить всё своей реакции.
[*] Эта графика словно кому-то дали посмотреть 3D-фильмец, оставив только эти цвета, оттенки розового, черного, зеленого и синего. Это то, что продаёт игру, и это абсолютно серьезно. Многие пропустят её, но с этим видом всё обретает другие очертания <3
[*] Процедурность - это то, что дает игре возможность быть реиграбельной.
[*] ХАРДКОР. Вы можете попытаться пробежать все уровни до конца, но скорее всего вы просто помрете по неопытности, не зная какие существа Вас ожидают. Высокий уклон на скилл, вместо нелепых рандомов.[/list]

Можно сказать, что игре чего-то не хватает для полного счастья.
Но даже с этим чувством игрока ждет настоящее наслаждение от игрового процесса, особенно если есть склонность к жанру рогаликов.

[h1]Оценка: [b]8.0[/b][/h1]
[i]~ снимаю шляпу перед разрабами, оправдали все ожидания от игры[/i]

[spoiler][b]* Ваш покорный [u][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31431250/]Слуга-Куратор[/url][/u][/b][/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198122396094', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1688168902}
review:
Heavy Bullets es un shooter retro con graficos y estilo muy pero muy atractivos, el objetivo del juego es pasar 8 niveles (largos), si mueres, MUERES!, NO respawn, NO items caidos, solo la tristeza de morir :,v por cada nivel se van agregado mas tipos de enemigos, mas espacios abiertos, dificultad, etc..hay mucha variedad de items, sobre todo.. cuida tus balas!!! 
Muy recomendado 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198039870205', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1429982332}
review:
Занятный шутер-рогалик. Неплохая фишка с пулями, которых конечное число, но которые можно подобрать после использования и снова стрелять. Игра обостряетс тем, что нужно аккуратно стрелять и когда кончаются пули - выбегать и скакать по полю собирая драгоценный металл. Впрочем, имеются ещё и бомбы. Кроме того в отличие от прочих рогаликов здесь не явная комнатная архитектура. Уровень выглядит как обычный коридорный шутер.
В принципе, половину игры можно пройти довольно легко если аккуратно действовать. А босс уничтожает. Его можно только передагамать, наверное, а это значит что всё как обычно. Повезло с лутом - прошёл босса. Неповезло - не прошёл. Визуально игра интересна. Но я бы не рекомендовал её брать, разве что со скидкой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015074622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1678688479}
review: Don't be fooled by the simple learning experience that is the first level of Heavy Bullets' multi-floored journey. What follows is a test of wits, reflexes, and patience. This game will chew you up and spit you out whole if you do not approach it with caution and accept the fact that you are a new player. Like The Binding of Isaac, you will have to learn the items, the enemies, and, as an extra added bonus, where some of the enemies tend to hide. All of this makes for a fun experience. Not to mention the error-esque colors of the game world's enviornments, which are bound to make you wonder if the facility you are wondering about in is even real to begin with. Who are you? Where are you? And what are you doing? The game's so hard that I haven't made it to the end yet to find out. Very fun. Play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106303947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1446324259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170385785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1439647825}
review:
La direction artistique est trop étrange. Personnellement, même en mettant la luminosité à 0 sur mon écran, le jeu me pète les yeux. 
Les décors et les ennemis, bien que générés aléatoirement, se répètent très vite.

Il n'en reste pas moins que l'idée générale (faire un Rogue-like / FPS) est bonne.

Au final, vu que je l'ai payé 2€, il n'y a pas de regrets, mais ça ne vaut pas le coût de le payer plus cher à mon avis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213042325', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1667962506}
review:
This game has been the highlight of much of my gaming time. I was recently able to connect a PS4 to my laptop...this game, as impossible as it may seem, gets like a million times better with a controller. Not only would I recommend this game to my friends, but I actually force it onto my roommate. There are some things that would make this, already fantastic game, all the better: adding more algorthmic possibilities for the room structures and layouts would add some more fear to the game, in the two hours of gameplay I have experienced, I have already started to notice some patterns. It would also be great to be able to have a sort of co-op or competitive co-op implimented into this game. It would also be great if this game were to be released on home consoles *cough* PS4 *cough* but whatever you do with this game, just know it is f***ing amazing. Lastly, I would love to see an endless mode for this game (dispite not being able to get past level 3).

overall 100/10 would buy and will play again

author: {'steamid': '76561198022879589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1666137974}
review:
Really surprised by this game.  I'm not much of an FPS fan, generally hate brightly colored stuff, and don't particularly care for "retro/pixel/blockiness".  But I got this in a bundle, and figured I'd give it a try, since both the system requirements and install size are low.  Wow, this is really good.  Simple dynamics, fairly random levels, and seems pretty easy at first.  But no, it's actually quite hard.  Assuming you don't go read a bunch of walkthroughs, it'll take you quite a few deaths to start piecing together the important stuff, tricks, etc to make it more than a couple levels.  And I love the balance of fairly easy death with the ability to pass things on to future tries via the bank/storage.

Still haven't beaten the game, but love to pick it up now and then to keep trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029910586', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1443627185}
review:
Вы играете с пистолетом, у вас есть 3 жизни, вам нужно добраться до 8 этажа. Противники каждый раз одинаковые, с каждым этажом добавляются новые. Имеется пара боссов. Не забываем что этажей всего 8, а вам нужно каждый раз начинать заново. Этажи очень маленькие. Каждый раз ничего не меняется, разнообразия ноль. Возможно это только у меня, но как только я захожу в комнату игра фризит на доли секунды, что не мешает пушкам пару раз в меня попасть.  Я полагаю фризы это типо генерация, но с такими картами можно было сгенерировать сразу все 8 этажей и еще 40 в придачу.
 Игра ценой в 1$, не более. Геймплей скудный. Даже на NES рогалики лучше выходили. Игра надоедает уже за первый час.
Если вы ищите хороший рогалик, лучше поиграйте в Rogue Legacy, ziggurat, Risk of Rain, Don't Starve, eldritch и т.д. а это убожество можно и пропустить.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065971311', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1439403256}
review:
[u][b]Heavy Bullets[/b][/u] is a amazing FPS dungeon crawler with random generating structures.

Pros
+ Orginal Graphics!
+ Nice colours 
+ Amazing monsters
+ Orginal idea!
+ Achievements
+ Worth Price
+ Random generated maps
+ Bosses
+ Upgrades/Shops
+ Trading Cards
+ You always want back! Trust me!
+ Traps!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978384534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1455802528}
review:
Auch etwas für Nicht-Magenta-Liebhaber!

Gameplay:
Steuerung, Tastenbelegung und Performance sind gut umgesetzt. Ob auf meinem Gaming PC oder Macbook, Heavy Bullets läuft flüssig. Teilweise finde ich das bombenwerfen etwas willkürlich.

Grafik:
Fühlt sich ein bisschen an wie ein Poly-Neon-LSD-Trip. Der Grafikstil ist sehr ansprechend und zieht einen sofort in die atmosphärische Spielwelt.

Fazit:
Nach ca. 6 Stunden Spielzeit, unzähligen Runden Spielspaß und ein paar Aufschreien von Schimpfwörtern aufgrund eigenen Vesagens, kann ich mit bestem Gewissen "Heavy Bullets" empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963662536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1503706829}
review:
Really simple and enjoyable.  If you like the idea of a simple to grasp roguelite FPS with the nifty feature of being able to pick up fired bullets, I say go for it.  Wait for a sale or whatever, but it's pretty fun.

In case you haven't gotten the run-down on the game, here it is:

Though it's labeled as roguelike and it mostly is, it's technically not, because your bank account doesn't die.  So you could technically just grind until you get enough money to buy every single thing you need in one playthrough.  But that would be lame.  You wouldn't do that would you?

After you fire bullets, you can pick them back up from where they land, and put them back in your gun.  Bullets and coins will gravitate to you if you get close enough, and you can upgrade that feature.

Shops, enemies, and levels are randomly arranged per playthrough.  Shop inventories are also unpredictable.

Main thing I wish this game had was a difficulty option.  But if you want hard mode, just get drunk or high and play it.  Legally of course.

Co-op or deathmatch would also be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994641567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1455533191}
review:
It is somewhat reluctantly that I am giving Heavy Bullets this negative review.

A lot of the game is good: The art design is sweet, the music plays in well, the enemy types are just varied enough, and the sensitivity and gunfeel is spot on.  It's gimmick, the way you have to pick up and conserve bullets plays out really well and the game does a great job of making that fun.

But there are all these roguelike mechanics that just make me not enjoy my runs.  You can bank gold and an item for a future run.  You can only carry one item at a time, or two with a backpack.  The shops are randomised, so you aren't always able to buy what you want.  There are some certainties: the Medical shop will always have heals and the ammo shop will always have bullets, but you are in no way guaranteed a shot at the rarer upgrades such as the backpack or increased MaxHP.  That last one's a killer, especially when there's no way to practice against bosses.

Furthermore, while the level design is complex and fun to run around in, it doesn't always make much sense.  You find shops before you find enemies and hence have no money to spend.  There are doors that go to empty rooms.  Some levels will have three secrets in them, and in some runs I can go three or more levels without finding a secret.  Now, since you can only carry one or two items, missing out on a few extra choices isn't so bad, except for the fact that you can sell items for money.  I just feel that having a few failsafes built into the level generation would be a huge boon.  Other games in the genre ensure a secret in each level, or a locked shop, or an item, or something, but with Heavy Bullets the only consistancy are the banking machines.

Perhaps that's part of the game's design, part of it's theme:  You have to grind up to win.  You have to throw away lives failing in order to pay to win.

It's a decent enough game, but it's just so discouraging to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097628507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1566349298}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992731830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2481, 'last_played': 1663549007}
review:
This game has real art style, thoughtful mechanics and bliss-provoking sound design.

But every time I die it's because some damn snake the same color and number of polygons as the bush it's hiding in killed me, and that isn't fun.

Having to inspect every single geographical feature for safety is a boring way to ruin a cool game.

2/3/15 EDIT: I stand by everything but this I'm only upset because I have such affection for this game and small improvements would make a world of difference.

That said, it's work of auteurship, and a compelling blend of mechanics.

5/6/16 EDIT 2: OK I saw this was on sale again, very cheap, so I thought I would reiterate some of my warm feelings.

This is a great, very elegant game for people with a sophisticated appreciation of crunchy design mechanics and genre-jamming.

The spare story elements and art style encourage, nay, demand a level of creative investment on the part of the player, ensnaring you into building a character, plot and context for your motivation to survive.

It's a really excellent game, my relationship to which I would liken to some of my favorite albums: I disliked it at first, but was intrigued to understand why, only later to fall in love.

You should buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043971033', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1440291344}
review:
Heavy Bullets is an FPS/Rogue-lite in which you play a nameless, blank character in an exceedingly colorful nameless dungeon for no real reason who is armed with the game's hook: a revolver that shoots giant heavy bullets, which can be recollected for more uses though the revolver usually has a low ammo reserve so every shot matters. As you progress you fight various strange enemies who attack in either the most basic or most dastardly ways possible. The most basic enemy is an imp with huge teeth which just runs in straight lines to get to you and bite your face off. Imps won't dodge, won't curve paths, make loud noises to warn you, and won't stop chasing you except to rotate X amount of degrees when confronted with a corner; so they're boring, a nuisance instead of a threat, and lame. Another simple enemy is the turret. You encounter a number of laser shooting turrets which are either easy or hard based on how many other turrets are around, because they all fire fast and have to be hit in a specific location. If there's only one or two it's a bit of a cakewalk if you aim right. Otherwise they'll light you up if there's more. Conversely, there's also snakes which hide in the dense foliage, waiting for you to get close to leap out and posion you. Snakes are usually hidden well, quiet, and often manage to leave a lasting poison which I've had take off three hearts of health before (important note here is that you start with 3 hearts and I only ever maxed out at 5 hearts) so a cheap enemy is one of the biggest threats. Then there's my favorite of the game's many FU's. The living bomb bug. You get suicide rushed by small purple bugs that zoom at you like they're trying to win the fucking Indy 500 race so it can do a large AOE blast which does a full heart of damage and seems to stun you briefly. Remember, you only start with 3 hearts, slow movement for an FPS, and everything is overgrown and neon colors, so it's a HUGE THREAT. So, basically the enemy design sucks both for the player's survival, and for the player's lasting interest in playing at all, because they are so uninspired and have limited AI.

Continuing with gameplay feedback; there are a number of items in game to pickup, similar to say, The Binding of Isaac, where there's both "use" items and "passive" items. Unlike BoI however, you can only carry 1 or 2 items total in Heavy Bullets depending on whether or not you bought a backpack. There's a good variety in items, though most aren't as helpful as they should be. For instance, there's a "use" item called the Ritual Knife, which deals the player a heart of damage and used to give you as many coins as you would need to buy a heart on that floor, but now jips you a few coins. Another such neutered item is the "passive" Repelent, which claims to repel bugs and snakes, which would be so great if it actually did so. Instead the repelent only gives the player an extra secind before they attack. So, snakes and bomb bugs will still ruin your fun constantly anyway. The items that actually are good with no downside don't have a big payoff, so there's no full heal just minor, the antidote only cures poison for one instance of poison, and there's no lasting buffs- just ones that last a few seconds. So items play a smaller role than they typically do in this type of game.

As far as lasting thoughts, I felt like it was a game that would have been a gem had it been made in the 90's, as a lot of the ideas would have been fresher and more appreciable then. Rogue-lite's weren't really a trend back then, and the randomized dungeons would have been novel. The visuals are really basic, but 3d games usually were in the 90's. The music was not really very inspired, and should have played a lot more. Sound effects were quite bad. It's hard to get to like a big gun that makes a small "boof" noise, creatures sounded as robotic as the turrets, and everything sounded like it came through a bad chipset with a damaged speaker. I think the character was supposed to occasionally say things like "Oh yeah!" and "Whew!" but it sounded like the sound desginer(s?) burped and farted into a mic or attempted to go for 80's level synthization. All those sound issues would be easier to overlook in the 90's when it was harder and often expensive to get good sound in videogames, but here it's off-putting now.

Overall, a dissapointment on many fronts. I love FPS'es, Roguelites, and games with some style, but this let me down in every cateogory. Things just don't meld well in this game, and the existing content is rudimentary and unfun. 4/10.
If you want a good example of an FPS/Roguelite which delivered where this game failed, I suggest Eldritch or Ziggurat. Eldritch has more stealth, adventure, and horror elements complemented by immersive sound design. Ziggurat provides better FPS movement, more interesting items, weapons, enemies, and impressive visual flair.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996447559', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1443116269}
review:
It's not often that a game comes about and reminds us where video games came from. This may be an overused saying, but it is true to merit that Heavy Bullets is well worth the price. If atari games were brought into the modern age, they would play like this. Simple, challenging and fun. Nothing will hold you hand but you will find yourself adapting quickly and learning from past mistakes.

The simple graphics, fast-paced and devilishly challenging combat will pull you in with the incredibly simple underlying plot; make it through level 8.
Although I've only made it a few rooms into level 4 (and quickly learned how horrible I was at it) I know I will sink hours into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045101610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1428183695}
review:
An interesting rogue-like/FPS, Heavy Bullets had me hooked from the start. This game looks and feels fantastic. The combination almost low-poly style graphics mixed with a good lighting engine and [b]fantastic[/b] controls give you a sense of nostalgia but with a weird hint of modernness. And I love it. 

[b]This game is 100% worth your purchase, no doubt.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050219817', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1439003023}
review:
Tipico juego con perma-death donde haces muchas corridas intentando llegar al ultimo nivel, los niveles se generan aleatoriamente en cada corrida y los items con los que jugas son aleatorios.
La particularidad de este juego es que cada bala es un item y no desaparece cuando la disparas, de hecho la tenés que ir a buscar o te quedas sin balas.

El juego es bastante jodido, genera una sensación tensa constante porque los niveles son cerrados, tenés poca vida y nunca sabés con que te podés encontrar al girar la esquina.
Los gusanos de mierda que se esconden en los arbustos me hacian cagar en las patas cada vez que pisaba uno.

En lo personal no soy muy fan de la estetica, demasiado fluorecente. La musica y el sonido no son nada del otro mundo, pero acompañan.

En conclusión, el juego no esta mal, pero no me gusto tanto como otros del genero, por ejemplo el Ziggurat.
Lo recomiendo si te gusta este estilo de juegos o si buscas un FPS jodido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030702303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1605504394}
review:
I was doing a great run. Level 5, 5 hearts, plenty of money, and a good item. I turned a corner to a stand of megabombs. Hiding behind the stand, just out of sight, was an explosive creature. It ran at me and blew up in less than a second, setting off the bombs on the table. Before I could even gauge what just happened in that less than a second, the bombs that were released by the Megabombs blew me up, killing me. I was seething lava.

Recommended if you're into that kind of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028095380', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1483118426}
review:
A brutally punishing FPS with tight controls and precise shooting. 
Despite the above being true, this game lacks. Almost every death is cheap with snakeworms poisoning you with barely any health left on level 7. If it isn't snakeworms, it's the ridiculously powerful turrets (especially the ones that fire ROCKETS at you).
The bosses are the worst part - they're always far too quick for you to even understand what's happening as both of the 2 bosses last usually less than 15 seconds. Unless you have the focus pills (single-use slow motion powerup), you'll systematically either die or come out of the fight with half a heart left.
Besides all that, it's nevertheless a good FPS.

Did I mention performance? It's all over the place - I've read reviews in which performance was perfect, and others that complained about low FPS, which I have to confirm. The game runs poorly on a GTX970 and i5-4690k @ 3.50Ghz, a PC able to play almost any game on ultra with a steady framerate. This includes stuff like MGSV, Far Cry 4, Crysis 3, and other generally demanding games. 
The game doesn't look bad, but judging by the low amount of polygons and textures, there's really no excuse for it to dip down to 30-40FPS at random intervals. 

If you find it on sale, buy it. Despite my review being mostly negative, there are a lot of positive aspects to the game - but also negatives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984833745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1564363836}
review: I had my doubts about this game because I wasn't sure how a first person would work as a rogue-like shooter, so I waited until it went on sale. Even though I'm not a rogue-like fan, I have to say this is not only one of the better shooters I've played in a long time, it's the most well done rogue-like game I've ever played. I've really been into pixel retro platform games lately but never got over my love of a great FPS. Well this is both, and it's fantastic. It's fantastic because every bullet counts and you don't know what lies around the corner. And there are these vending machines you find quite regularly in the game which are either banks to deposit or withdraw your money so you can save your cash from game to game, buy new weapons and even upgrades. I also haven't written a review in awhile but I just had too with this game. This is the most fun I've had with a game in a long time, really. Get it, even at full price this title would be worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000607162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1711500975}
review:
Compelling game, you died easily but you feel that you should have done better and retry.
The game gives no information about the objects you find or buy, you find all that by experience, by playing. You can deposit one object and money and those are avalable for future playthroughs, but everything you carry disappears when you die. The lack of info about the items makes it hard to know if you should buy things or save money, that you'll have to learn by experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120967947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1708664283}
review:
So far, so good. Loving the fact that though it is a single-player shooter and it's fairly simple in objective, it's still pretty submersive. It takes focus, concentration, and quick reflexes for the times when you are attacked by surprise. The bright colors, simple geometry and revamped "classic arcade" sound effects give the game a fun life to be about.

Only slightly over one hour of playing as of this posting, and I still have yet to pass Level 2. I can tell this is going to be a good time-killing game for many hours ahead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041324282', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1462477977}
review:
First experience.

1, Try out gun

2. realize you have to run back to get the bullets and reload your gun

3. find a secret wall with a sacred blade and a wall that says free the imps

4. find a bank and deposit the blade and 3 cents

5. Kill some enemies no pressure at all they're not so hard :-)

6. reach lvl 2 

7. find a bottle of antidote drink it instantly and get bit by a snake right after

8. run around in panic looking for a way to heal

9. finds a machine that sells heal for 50c while you have 49c.....shit im dying

10. Keep running around looking for 1c and open a door revealing a robot that shoots me with a lazer

11. scream and soil pants a bit

12. Repeat

9/11 why am i never ever ducking lucky( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084321417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1439153897}
review: A little nice adventure in concrete-and-neon jungle. You will get some frustration and, eventually, fun. Hard enough to appreciate rarest achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1438927367}
review:
This game is perfectly fine. It's a good randomly-generated dungeon crawler with accuracy-based shooting and a fast pace. Everything dies in one hit except you. The core concepts are all fine, there's a lot of beneficial items to pick up but it never feels like you're screwed if you don't get good items or shop spawns. The sound design is interesting and sounds become a very important part of the game fairly quickly. Personally I felt the game got a bit monotonous after a bit though, a lot of the same enemies and the same scenery (at least as far as I got, that is).

Unfortunately, no matter how good the game is, it just seems roguelikes are a hopeless genre to me, especially ones as close to pure roguelike as this one (sans the banking system, which I barely needed to use). It's fun at its core but I like making progress, not getting stuck because I can't figure out how to beat the boss that doesn't show up until 15+ plus into the game and there's no way for me to practice it otherwise. It's not the fault of the game, as much as it is just my personal preference, but if didn't enjoy this roguelike I'm not going to enjoy any of them. Gonna stick to rogue-lites from now, yep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005091213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1609851418}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053570068', 'num_games_owned': 1777, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1438375248}
review:
[b]"Одно из лучших моих приобретений в магазине Steam"[/b]

Особенности, о которых невозможно умолчать:
- Игра которую можно пройти за 25 минут, затягивает на 30 часов.
- Минимализм пиксельной графики и "однооктавной" озвучки являются украшением игры. 
- Сочетание цветов и красок - самобытная гармония.
- Геймплей и атмосфера созданы на очень высоком уровне.

Спасибо Terri Vellmann за игру!
10 розовых тонов на черном из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158379413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1480898076}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096724003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1437104294}
review:
It's not fun or refreshing after the first hour.  After that, it's just charmless and hard.  And I will say I really did try.  I sat for a few hours three days in a row.  Didn't get past level 3.  I decided to take a few weeks' break and come back.  That didn't work.  Even tried this approach a third time and nothing but frustration to be found.

If you've got something to prove, this is the game for you.  If you wanna have fun like the rest of us, though;  I would not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067163104', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1437449512}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019851262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1439551597}
review: A very tense roguelite FPS with many elegant design decisions. I liked Tower of Guns, I liked Ziggurat, but Heavy Bullets is the best of this breed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998617023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1472342153}
review:
Constant micro-stuttering makes the game almost unplayable, and the devs seem to refuse to fix it. They are, however, still fine with taking money for a broken product.

Luckily, I got this with a humble bundle so I do not feel too cheated out of money.

I do not recommend that you purchase this game until the devs decide to patch up this problem that many people appear to be having. The devs could also add finer sensitivity options for those players who prefer to use lower mouse sensitivities or like to have consistant controls between games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056093759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1437579803}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197970767462', 'num_games_owned': 1906, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 4317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3057, 'last_played': 1636754674}
review:
Attention, ce jeu est très très TRES [b]addictif[/b] ! 
Ca fait plus de 50h que j'y joue, déjà,  j'ai l'impression que ça fait moins, et j'arrive encore a découvrir des nouvelles choses... (passages secrets et autres trucs qu'on peut faire avec les cailloux par exemple...)

Alors oui, quand je l'ai acheté (pendant des soldes) je ne savais pas du tout a quoi m'attendre, quand j'ai vu le petit poids qu'il fait, j'ai directement télécharger, puis je l'ai essayé, mais malgrès des graphismes très flashy et cubique, son univers carrément bizarre, le fait qu'il n'y ai qu'une armes (mais plein d'objets secondaires) j'ai tout de suite accroché !
Par contre, le jeu est [b]extrêmement punitif[/b], et rien que le premier boss (il y en a deux, et je ne suis arrivé a tuer le premier qu'après presque 13h de jeu... hahah...) est déjà super dur à tuer. Et si tu perds, tu recommence tout de zéro ! (ou presque)

Tenez, si vous voulez voir un peu a quoi sa peut ressembler !

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Srs0o1PFOHY

Bon, allez, sur ceux, j'y retourne, ça fait 3 parties que je me dis [i]"Bon, après celle ci, j'arrête !"[/i], je viens de quitter le jeu y'a même pas 10 minutes, je pars le relancer... ^^"


[b][u]P.S[/u][/b] : Faites attention aux [u]"snakes"[/u] (qui ressemble quand même beaucoup plus a des asticots féroces, ne nous cachons pas...), qui sont les ennemies les plus chiants de ce jeu ! :p

author: {'steamid': '76561198029841156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1519951297}
review: Fantastic aesthetics and an interesting concept, yet very challenging from the very first level. This is a game that just waits for you to make a wrong move or get reckless at the worst possible moment. The ambience, soundtrack, and near-perfect framerate make this game come alive, while the old-school polygon graphics and sounds, coupled with the enemy variety, randomly generated maps, and whatnot make this game a fantastic break from Triple-A First Person Shooters. I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys challenging video games or just wants to waste a few minutes by popping some monsters in the face with a six-shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991246556', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1436717180}
review:
Dungeon Crawler... ouai ça on connait ... mais FPS dungeon crawler ... mmmh !
(pour les flemmards - le résumé au début)
Résumé : honête qualité/prix, jolies couleurs/graphisme, rétro mais pas trop (bon compromis), original, difficile mais prise en main simple, configuration des touches possible (jouable manette ? je ne crois pas) et surtout même si la musique est peu présente l'immertion est total ! ... très bon jeu

Très efficace, joliement coloré, monstres interessants avec pattern spécifique et sons qui permettent de les différenciers. Beaucoup de die & retry, d'apprentissage des pattern tant au niveau des sections de niveaux que des monstres, très jouissif et peu stressant à ce que l'on pourrait croire.

Vos premières "run" seront (jusqu'à votre premier affrontement du boss final ... no spoil) immersive, intense et tellement lente car vous ferez des straffs (pas de côté) en sortie de mur histoire de voir ce qui va vous arrivez ...

Pour avoir fini le jeu à 100%, Speedrun y compris (première speedrun de jeu vidéo de ma vie ... personnellement) le jeu en lui même est simple, facile à comprendre et répétitif (mais non ennuyeux car tout est aléatoire.. j'y reviendrais après)

Donc il plaira aux vieux de la vieille qui ont jouer sur Atari ou Comodor et aux jeunes d'aujourd'hui call of / counter strike ... voir même aux jeunettes avide de jeu rétro style mais non casual.... car oui jouable souris mais difficile quand même (prise en main en 5 minutes chrono par contre !!)

Le point principal et non négligeable est le faite que le jeu se génère de façon aléatoire (mais pas à 100%) car chaque run sera unique, pattern du niveau / monstres et bonus / stations (medbay, bank, etc) seront plus ou moins là où vous pouvez les attendre et ne seront peut-être pas les même ! donc des run plus dur que d'autres !

moins négatif cependant, le jeu peut saccader cela arrive (attention aux options du genre Vsync à désactiver de préférence) et surtout peut devenir frustrant que vous avez la loi de murphy sur le dos ! (principe qui consiste à avoir le jeu contre vous : peu de bonus, monstres bien placés et/ou en groupe efficace du genre tourelle caché derrière un buisson et un monstre devant qui vous invite à le tuer... et pan ! tuer par derrière X_X)
dernier point négatif et/ou positif selon qui jouera est le fait que la difficultée n'est pas programmable... donc vous pourrez avoir une facilité déconcertant à faire le premier niveau en 45sec ... comme en 1.45mins... car certains monstres n'apparessant qu'au niveau suivant pourraient s'introduire dans se niveau et OH SURPRISE ! ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197960534560', 'num_games_owned': 2695, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1587085171}
review: Interesting concept, and somewhat fun to play, but it has a crippling stutter/lag bug that makes the game unplayable for any length of time.  You'll find yourself dying because the game locked up for a second while still processing your last input, so you wind up running into a room full of enemies that kill you before you can respond or escape.  The dev was originally quite responsive, but has gone completely silent and seems to have abandoned the game.  DO NOT BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094198821', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1617814871}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023005271', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1436293036}
review:
The Binding of Isaac + Fps = Heavy Bullets
[h1] Kısaca	[/h1]
 -Oyun Rogue-like tarzında ölünce her şeye farklı haritayla baştan başlıyorsunuz.Her oynayışınızda farklı Eşyalar ile karşılaşıyorsunuz.Ama Canavarlar her oynayışınızda aynı sırayla önünüze geliyor.Önce basit sonra daha zor düşmanlar olarak düşünülebilir.
-Hızlı olmanız gerekiyor durup nişan alıyım öyle vuruyum gibi bir şansınız yok.Gördünüz ya o sizi vurur ya siz onu.
 
[h1] Güzel Yanları	[/h1]
-Değişik grafikler
-Kolay öğreniliyor
-Rastgele eşyalar ve oyun haritası tekrar tekrar sıkılmadan oynamanızı sağlıyor
-Müzikler size harika bir şekilde eşlik ediyor. iyi bir kulaklığınız varsa sadece sesleri dinleyerek bile oynabilirsiniz.
-Nereden ne çıkacağınız bilmeğiniz için hep tetikte olmanız gerekiyor bu da ayrı bir tat veriyor.

[h1] Kötü Yanları	[/h1]
-Başta değişik gelen grafikler zamanla sıkabiliyor
-Tüm rogue-like oyunlarları gibi canınızı sıkıp sizi sinirlendirebiliyor

author: {'steamid': '76561198123632879', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1582328931}

author: {'steamid': '76561198157457372', 'num_games_owned': 8758, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1535, 'last_played': 1467494330}
review:
Heavy Bullets no es un shooter convencional, cada daño que recibes cuenta y se tienen unos controles más limitados que otros juegos del género.
Los enemigos no se andan con contemplaciones y apenas con sólo verles dos píxeles de sus cuerpos ya se giran para atacarte... y si decides huir, como el hombre del saco, te seguirán casi a tu ritmo, hasta que finalices el nivel o los elimines.
Olvídate de tener checkpoints a lo largo del juego, sólo te dan la opción de guardar y salir cada vez que termines uno de los niveles del juego. [b]Si mueres, empiezas el juego desde el principio[/b].
Otro de los desafíos que te puedes encontrar es el jefe que aparece a mitad del juego, bastante más difícil que el jefe final, pasarse ese jefe puede significar más posibilidades de completar el juego en esa partida. Pero lo peor que tiene este juego son las serpientes, vas andando/corriendo mirando con mucha precaución la próxima esquina hasta que, sin darte cuenta, pasas por un arbusto rosa y... ¡¡PAM!! Te llevas el susto de tu vida: una serpiente te ataca de improviso sin que la hayas visto antes y encima termina envenenándote.
Por si fuera poco, el juego va oscureciéndose hasta que sólo puedas guiarte con la luz que desprende la mirilla de la pistola, además de que el juego presenta ciertos picos de lag que arruinarán toda la cautela con que te mueves para eliminar a los terribles enemigos.

Hasta aquí todas las desventajas, pero este juego se puede caracterizar porque es un reto para quien lo juega, es necesario no desanimarse y perseverar. Al principio es fácil morir en los primeros niveles, pero a poco a poco nuestra pericia nos hará alcanzar los niveles más altos. [b]El juego no es imposible terminarlo, yo me lo pasé a los 7 días pese a que los shooter no es mi género predilecto[/b], e incluso ahora, tras pasármelo 6 veces, para mí es más fácil terminarlo que morir en el intento. Desde luego, pasarse el juego es de por sí la recompensa final después de un sin fin de adversidades. Pero si os parece incluso poco, conseguir todos los logros es un desafío aún mayor si cabe.
Los escenarios y los sonidos están muy bien pese a ser tan psicodélicos. La banda sonora no tiene tanta variedad, pero hay alguna que otra que realmente te motivan a perseverar en el objetivo de finalizar el juego.
Otra carácterística muy interesante es que todo se compra a través de máquinas dispensadoras de refrescos, pero hay un tipo de ella que es el banco, donde puedes ingresar/retirar dinero. Como consejo, mientras no os familiaricéis con el juego, id guardando todo el dinero que recibais (se guardará para la partida actual y para las futuras), porque si no tenéis el seguro de vida, lo perderéis TODO al morir. Por eso, incluso teniendo una fortuna en el banco y mucha experiencia, no garantiza que te vayas a pasar el juego.

Mi valoración general es que es un buen juego, muy interesante para aquel que quiera probar un shooter diferente o bien le gusten los desafíos, porque a pesar de la dificultad, se puede disfrutar mucho con él.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171865447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1599674145}
review: A blast to play, tense, and fun every playthrough as I've died consistently and felt great about it. Dying doesn't feel cheap--it's a strategy as you figure out what all the powerups and figure out how to bank your money most efficiently. Pick it up sometime! I play my own music though, as it gets kinda quiet with only the (still quite effective) sound effects. Wish there was some music, but that's about it. Looking forward to playing more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001844834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1500153836}
review:
Roguelike FPS with a bizarre Tumblr kid aesthetic. Very little in the way of storyline.

Sometimes it's best to progress slowly, and sometimes you just have to run in the room gun blazing. Could use a bit more map & enemy variety in my opinion, but I still can't get past level 4, which could be the real issue.

Not as in-depth and RPG-like as Eldrich, but still a fun change of pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003573359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1432234051}
review: A fun fast-paced Roguelike with amazing visuals and steep difficulty. This heavily stylized world is really promising and can keep you playing for a long time after purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102322910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1468003079}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015128252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1655450137}
review:
The limited ammo isn't really a problem unless you're one of those kinds that just can't hit things even though theres a crosshair. This turns into a problem later, though after you find enemies that are harder to hit (smaller damage areas, faster moving, etc.) 
Even so, after you figure out an enemy's gimmick and how to handle them, they dont become a problem unless you're facing more than 5 at a time, which is (thankfully) rare.
Items are neat and can change how you play a bit, but nothing too dramatic.
Cool idea, but rouge-lite. You can save money in a bank and pull it out in a different run, kind of invalidating any need for money (which you can use at the many vending machines littered about to buy items) if you play long enough.
No to rouge-lites

author: {'steamid': '76561198130228779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1433915377}
review:
It took me six runs before I realized there were snakes in the bushes. I literally thought those damn bushes were coming alive to kill me. 

11/10 would get killed by a bush agai--- Shit, I just died again. 

Serious review time:

Heavy Bullets is a fast-paced FPS that really requires twitch shooting skills to make it very far. I don't have those. But I still have a ton of fun getting to level two then dying. There are weird dog-like creatures with giant teeth, malfunctioning security turrets that WON'T FUCKING DIE oh wait, you have to shoot the green box, well that was easy, OH SHIT A BUSH JUST ATE ME, oh nevermind, it's a snake in the bush, sweep sweep sweep, look around every corner super slowly and all of a sudden this isn't a fast paced shooter anymore, now I've spent thirty minutes on the first level nervously poking my head around every corner and emptying the gun, then picking up the bullets and scanning every bush for snakes. 

11/10 would write a horrible review again.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198084357077', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1432145588}
review:
Summary: joyless, gratuitous frustration.

This is coming from someone who appreciates bullet hell shooters and twitch-based games.

Success in this game is more heavily dictated by luck than by the player's actions, and rarely will you die feeling like you were to blame instead of one of the various ill-designed or broken mechanics that plague Heavy Bullets.

You will suffer from:
- Getting hit by explosions and turret fire that hit the opposite side of a wall (broken hit detection)
- Exploding enemies that spawned around a corner in a tight corridor and trigger immediately (no-win situation)
- Turrets that seem to fire with a set interval, but glitch and fire in quick succession out of nowhere
- Seemingly no player damage rate limiter (full life to death in no time if unlucky)
- Terrible enemy AI that's overcompensated with dumb attribute buffs in speed/damage.
- Grating sounds emitted frequently by every unpicked bullet and coin
- Uninformative and confusing menus
- Assorted glitches, such as the reticle jittering (on Windows) or even jumping around (on Linux) with mouse movement.

And I see no sign that any of it is going to be improved.

This game looked charming and fun at first, but it turned out to be frustrating, grating and unrewarding.
It just feels like a poorly programmed game, which is par for the course with Unity games, to be fair.

Now excuse me, as I'm going to play Rogue Legacy — a proper procedurally-generated action roguelike with inheritance — to get rid of this feeling of undue frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960948549', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1432471873}
review:
Fun game!  Unfortunately it is not without its problems.  There is a stutter issue which can unfairly cause you to take damage and possibly die if you are at low enough health.  For a game which requires some skill to play, having to restart due to stutter death is frustrating.

The only other issue is the bosses are easy to exploit.  If you sit in the spawn room, you can more or less clear the room without taking damage.  This should be fixed in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042757315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1434149876}
review:
I really recommend this game! Especially if youi're a fan of Rogue-likes!

Why should I buy this game?
-Its a procedurally-generated level system, meaning, everytime you play, the levels change! You never know what to expect
-It's really exciting - theres enemies around every corner so you gotta be super careful and peek around. Survival gaming at its greatest. 
-It's super hard - but fair! Every enemy gives fair warning, so if you die, its either because you got careless, went too fast or wasn't prepared. So it makes you want to try again and again! Great replayability!
-You can grind to victory! In a sense. You can deposit the cash you collect in the bank for future runs, allowing you rack up a ton of cash for use right from the start!
-Design is super-unique! Apart from (and I'm stretching it here) Hotline Miami and Far Cry Blood Dragon, you won't find this neon retro style. The stark color contrast also makes things pop out, which is good for gameplay, such as the bright weak spots of enemies.
-Music and sound are all top-notch! The music picks up whenever theres enemies around - a nice jungle battle theme - than dies down when everything's dead. The sound effects are all delightfully (in my opinion) retro and the enemy popping (yes they pop in pieces, like Lego) sounds in particular are very satisfying.

What's not so good?
-Its nail-bitingly difficult. You can only take a few hits, and enemies hit FAST and UNEXPECTEDLY. Within a minute of your first playthrough you'll be left with 1/2 of a heart left, gasping and cringing at the low-health sound. Then, you'll reach the first boss and possibly destroy your controller as he destroys you in a split-second. Which is a good point for some, a bad point for others. I personally find it a tad bit TOO DIFFICULT.
-There's not that many enemies in the game really, but there's enough and their placement always changes.
-Can be confusing for new players. It was complicated to configure the xbox controller - it isn't automatic. There's no tutorial. You'll suicide by accidentally throwing a bomb. Enemies look like the rocks and bushes. In stores, it doesn't say what things do. You just gotta try it out and figure it out on your own.
-The game isn't terribly balanced. Some items are awesome, but most are terrible to useless. Most players will have to resort to stocking one particular item in the bank and ALWAYS USING THE SAME THING. That's kinda sad.

Can't really think of any real faults in the game other than that. Its just perfect at what it does, so it doesn't need to be overly ambitious like GTA V.

Best way to enjoy this game is playing on the couch with friends and watching them squirm as they go through the labyrinth! Pop open those beers! Drink everytime he gets hit! (one swig per half-heart).

HAVE FUN! :)

review:
Heavy bullets is a very fun game, if you like a challenge. In no way shape or form should you rush through this even though the walking *cough* running pace is fast...I believe it should be toned down. The bosses are simple, yet difficult being only two. After beating it once I still find myself creeping around corners room clearing as I have every upgrade the shopping stalls have offered me (it's random what you get). Enemies have a good balance and are actually seemingly well placed in a randomly generated room clearing game. You get a balance of melee enemies, ranged enemies, and flying/ground enemies that can be ranged or melee. You also get that random Muslim that's oddly pink and charges you just to suicide bomb you....The second I see that bastard I can hear it now....JIHAD, ALLAH AKABAR! ***Modders get on it, I want pink little ball creatures that scream Islam nonsense at me.***

9/10 Would play FPS dark souls again. And die again, and not lose my $1,000 that I keep on me because last will....always get last will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049885647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1431729109}
review:
Heavy Bullets is a rogue-lite (not roguelike, which I'll get to later) FPS that ISN'T a terrible game, but not something that I would recommend.

Let's start with some pros and cons:
Pros:
-Level generation is very good and provides a high level of area variety with the occasional secret.
-The ammo system of retrieving your scarce bullets flows very well.
-In my experience, the game performed very, very well. No performance issues.
-Gameplay is fast with little downtime.

Cons:
-The game has VERY LITTLE content, and a pretty good amount of that content isn't very exciting. Within 3 hours of play, I had reached the final boss and experienced most of what the game has to offer.
-The graphics and sound, while part of the game's specific art style, are abysmal.
-Gameplay is VERY unbalanced. You will encounter large numbers of trivial creatures, while occasionally facing off against turrets that are much, much more powerful. While there are plenty of effective strategies I used against these turrets, I found that they are very inconsistent; with buggy mobile varieties that can glitch and shoot through walls, and stationary varieties that can turn their gun a full 180 degrees in the blink of an eye. This makes gameplay against these foes extremely frustrating.
-The game offers the ability to save your money and items for later runs, but this is very slow, boring, and grind-y. This is also the reason why this game should be considered a rogue-lite rather than a true roguelike.

Some other points to consider:
-There is no real story present except for a few lines of start-up text, but this isn't really a bad point in my eyes; I'd rather have no story than an awful story.

Overall, I'd say that Heavy Bullets isn't a bad title to play if you get it on sale (AT LEAST 50% off) or in a Humble Bundle (I got it in the Humble Roguelike Bundle), but you are overpaying if you pay the full $9.99 for it.

Thanks for reading (assuming you did).
